Madame Maimouna is a married woman aged 30 and the mother of seven children, all of them sons. She has been selling fruit for a long time. She has a good deal of experience in this field. Her new loan of 55,000 XOF will allow her to buy baskets of mangoes which she will then sell along the highway. 

The profit from her business will allow her to support herself but also to help her husband feed their family.

loans.use: to buy fruit

loans.name: El Mimbre Group

texts.es:
El grupo “El Mimbre” está ubicado en el centro de San Pedro El Alto, pero para llegar a la casa del grupo es necesario llegar caminando y es muy casado, ya que hay que recorrer una vereda muy larga. El nombre del grupo se eligió porque así se llama el barrio donde viven los integrantes. En dicha comunidad, se llevan a cabo las fiestas más grandes el 31 de diciembre y 1° de enero, donde se celebra la llegada del año nuevo.

El grupo está integrado por personas muy alegres y agradecidos con la institución, son ocho mujeres y un hombre. Todos han solicitado el crédito para ocuparlo en sus comercios: Doña Irene invertirá en su mercería, María Juana en una tienda de abarrotes, la señora Cesárea comprara borregos, la señora Josefina invertirá en comprar reparaciones de un taxi para su esposo, la señora Eulalia compara jarcería para sus venta, Doña Modesta comprara fregones (productos de limpieza) para su venta, María Josefina invertirá en accesorios de fantasía, Don Leonardo invertirá en abarrotes, semillas, frutas  y legumbres.

Doña Cesaria quien es la represente del grupo, tiene 54 años de edad, está casada con el señor Demetrio desde hace 30 años, juntos formaron una familia pero por el momento ya no tienen dependientes aunque están apoyando a nieto con sus estudios: Yosmar quien estudia el cuarto grado de primaria.

Doña Cesaria tiene una tienda de abarrotes desde hace 20 años hasta ahora no tiene nombre pero esta pensando en ponerle uno. Cesaria ya lleva un largo periodo trabajando con la institución. Esta vez solicitó el crédito para surtir su tienda de abarrotes; comprara dulces, jabón, leche, huevo, pan etc.  Cesaria comenta que inicio vendiendo dulces en su casa y después pensó en iniciar su tienda de abarrotes. La dificultad  que presenta es la competencia que tiene en el lugar donde vive, pero no se desanima ya que continuamente abren muchas tiendas que al final terminan cerrando. el crédito le ha ayudado de mucho ya que puede comprar mercancía suficiente para dos o tres meses. Está muy agradecida ya que con sus ganancias, su calidad de vida ha mejorado y esa era una de sus metas. Las ganancias las invierte en los gastos del hogar y para la educación de su nieto entre otras cosas.

Ella y el grupo en general están muy agradecidos con el préstamo otorgado ya que será de gran ayuda para invertir en sus negocios.
texts.en:
El Mimbre Group is located in the center of San Pedro El Alto, but to get to the group's house you have to arrive on foot and it is very tiring because you have to travel a very long way.  They chose the name of the group because it is the name of the neighborhood where the members live.  In this community the biggest celebrations are on 31 December and 1 January, when they celebrate the arrival of the new year.

The group is made up of very happy people who are grateful to the institution.  They are eight women and one man.  All of them have requested the loan to use in their businesses.  Irene will invest in her merchandise and María Juana in a grocery store.  Cesárea will buy lambs.  Josefina will invest in taxi repairs for her husband.  Eulalia will buy plastic goods to sell.  Modesta will buy scouring pads (cleaning products) to sell.  María Josefina will invest in costume jewelry and Leonardo in groceries, seeds, fruits, and vegetables.

Cesaria, who is the representative of the group, is 54 years old and has been married to Demetrio for 30 years.  They had a family together but at the moment no longer have dependents, although they are supporting a grandson in his studies, Yosmar, who is in fourth grade.

Cesaria has had a grocery store for 20 years.  Up to now it has not had a name, but she is thinking about giving it one.  Cesaria says she began selling candy in her house and later thought about opening her grocery store.  The difficulty that comes up is the competition in the area where she lives.  She does not get discouraged, though, because new stores are constantly opening but later end up closing.

Cesaria has been working with the institution for a long time now.  This time she requested the loan to supply her grocery store; she will buy candy, soap, milk, eggs, bread, etc.

The loan has helped her a lot because she can buy enough merchandise for two or three months.  She is very grateful because her quality of life has improved with her profits, and this was one of her goals.  She invests her profits in the household expenses and on her grandson's education, among other things.

She and the group in general are very grateful for the loan granted because it will be very helpful to invest in their businesses.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, milk, bread, eggs, soda, etc.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos es un joven con muchos deseos de superación , es agricultor, muy  trabajador y vive en una comunidad  situada en  la zona Sur de Costa Rica, ubicada en Concepción de Pilas, Puntarenas, llamada La Danta.  La economía local está basada en actividades agropecuarias, donde destaca la siembra de tubérculos, café, maíz, frijoles y ganadería.
El está solicitando un préstamo de ₡600.000 (seiscientos mil colones), para  comprar insumos agrícolas para su cosecha, como  abono ,  fungicidas  y herbicidas ya que debe  proteger sus cultivos durante el proceso de producción .  Con estos abonos, Santos  aumentará la capacidad que posee el suelo de absorber los distintos elementos nutritivos y con los fungicidas que utilizara gracias a este préstamo también evitara que aparezcan hongos en sus plantaciones,  así brindara productos de calidad a sus clientes,  y además podrá hacer frente a todas sus obligaciones y pagos para así sacar adelante a su familia.
El es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal denla Danta S.A, una de las 110 empresas de crédito comunal de Costa Rica y este es su segundo crédito.
texts.en:
Santos is a young man who has tremendous drive to succeed. He is a farmer and a very hard worker. Santos lives in a small community in southern Costa Rica called La Danta, which is located in Concepción de Pilas, Puntarenas. The local economy is based on agricultural activities such as growing tubers, coffee, corn, beans, as well as raising cattle.

Santos is requesting a loan of 600,000 CRC in order to buy farming supplies for planting such as compost, fungicides, and herbicides to protect his crops throughout the production process. With the use of compost, Santos will increase the capacity of the soil to absorb various nutrients. The fungicides will prevent the appearance of fungus on his crops and result in a better quality product for his customers. He will also be able to fulfill all of his obligations and payments so that his family can get ahead.

Santos is a member of La Danta Communal Credit Enterprise, S.A., one of the 110 credit organizations in Costa Rica. This is his second loan.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Erick

texts.es:
Erick es  un joven de agricultor, quien vive con su familia en una comunidad rural de Costa Rica llamada San Gabriel, localizada en Yolillal, Upala en la provincia de Alajuela. Es una comunidad rural con una extensión relativamente grande, con topografía semi-montañosa ubicada en Costa Rica, Centroamérica. Sus actividades principales son la agricultura de granos básicos, y en menor escala a la ganadería.

Erick confía en que con este proyecto de financiamiento agil y a bajo costo, el puede ayudar a  su familia a mejorar su situacion  economica .  Actualmente  Erick está solicitando un microcrédito  de  ¢1.050.000 (un millón cincuenta mil  colones), para sembrar cacao, el cual  venderá a buen precio en el centro de acopio de su comunidad.  Erick forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de San Gabriel, una de las 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica, con este crédito espera poder seguir creciendo como microempresario y sacar su negocio adelante. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas y de esta manera obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Erick is a young farmer, who lives with his family in a rural community in Costa Rica called San Gabriel.  It is located in Yolillal, Upala, in the province of Alajuela.  It is a rural community with a relatively large area and a semi-mountainous topography, located in Costa Rica in Central America.  The main activities in this area are farming basic grains, and on a smaller scale, livestock.

Erick confides that he will be able to help his family improve their financial situation with this financing project that is both speedy and low-cost.  Erick is currently requesting a micro-loan of ¢1,050,000 (one million and fifty-thousand colones) for planting cocoa, which he will sell for a good price at the collection center in his community.

Erick is part of the Communal Credit Company of San Gabriel, which is one of the 150 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica.  With this loan, he hopes to be able to continue growing as a micro-business, and to move his business forward.  He also highlights that thanks to this kind of organization and the means afforded by the loan, he can spend more time on productive activities and in this way earn greater profits.

loans.use: to grow cocoa.

loans.name: Yuri

texts.en:
Yuri is from the Khoni district, West Georgia. He is married and lives with his wife, Rita, his 7-year-old daughter, and his mother. Yuri works as a worker in a local lemonade factory. He works, on average, eight hours each day and earns 250 Laris each month. Also, the family has a small piece of land for a vineyard. Most of the harvest is consumed by the family; only a small surplus is sold to the local market. The family lives below the poverty line, and they receive relevant social assistance from their local government. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the vulnerably poor category.

Yuri has been planning to start up a family dairy farm for one year, but he didn’t have enough money. He couldn’t get credit from financial institutions because of his poverty and lack of business experience. His loan request was approved in the frames of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-up and restart-up credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high-risk borrowers” due to their low-income status. With the received credit, Yuri will purchase a cow. Rita will produce cheese, and Yuri’s mother will sell it on the local open market. The income of the family will double, and Yuri will be able to provide better living conditions for his little daughter. In addition to the above mentioned, Yuri’s family will have enough income to access regular credit products available on the country’s capital market, in case of need.

loans.use: To purchase a cow to start up a dairy farm

loans.name: Alexis

texts.es:
Alexis es un joven de 31 años de edad, quien vive con su familia en una comunidad rural de Costa Rica llamada San Gabriel, localizada en Yolillal, Upala en la provincia de Alajuela. Es una comunidad rural con una extensión relativamente grande, con topografía semi-montañosa ubicada en Costa Rica, Centroamérica. Sus actividades principales son la agricultura de granos básicos, y en menor escala a la ganadería.
Alexis considera que gracias al progreso de este proyecto, él y su familia han mejorado poco a poco sus condiciones de vida y han logrado ser actores en el desarrollo de la comunidad .  Actualmente  Alexis está solicitando un microcrédito  de  ¢1.050.000 (un millón cincuenta mil  colones), para comprar ganado, el cual  alimenta y lo vende cuando gana el peso apropiado . Alexis forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de San Gabriel, una de las 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica, con este crédito espera poder seguir creciendo como microempresario y sacar su negocio adelante. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Alexis, 31, is a young man who lives with his family in a rural community of Costa Rica named San Gabriel, located in Yolillal, Upala, in the province of Alajuela.  It is a rural community of a relatively large area with semi-mountainous topography located in Costa Rica, Central America.  The main jobs there are farming basic grains and, on a lesser scale, ranching.  Alexis considers that, thanks to the progress of this plan, he and his family have improved their living conditions gradually and been able to be involved in the development of the community.

Currently Alexis is requesting a micro-loan of 1,050,000 (one million, fifty thousand) colones [CRC] to buy cattle that he will feed and sell when it reaches the right weight.

Alexis is part of Empresa de Crédito Comunal de San Gabriel, one of 150 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica.  With this loan he hopes to be able to continue to grow as a small-business entrepreneur and get his business ahead.  He also emphasizes that, thanks to this type of organization and this means of facilitating credit, he is able to spend more time on productive activities.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Celina

texts.es:
La señora Celina tiene 34 años está casada con el señor  Guillermo tienen 3 hijos pequeños y  un bebe que apenas tiene meses, son una familia muy unida, la señora Celina trabaja prestando servicios de limpieza en diferentes casas en una zona donde viven familias de altos recursos económicos y de la misma manera el esposo trabaja realizando mantenimiento de las piscinas de las mismas familias, hasta hace poco vivían en una casa en alquiler donde el precio del alquiler era muy alta, entonces decidieron construir su propia casa en un terreno que era herencia de su padre de la señora Celina, poco a poco están construyendo ya tienen la obra bruta de la casa y les falto dinero para la compra de material para la obra fina, pues el destino del crédito será la compra de dicho material, y aunque la casa no está totalmente concluida ellos ya se fueron a vivir .
Entre sus sueños y mentas de la señora Celina esta terminar de construir totalmente  su casa donde sus hijos puedan vivir cómodamente en una habitación cada uno
texts.en:
Señora Celina is 34 years old, and is married to Señor Guillermo.  They have three young children and a baby who is barely a few months old.  They are a very united fmaily.

Señora Celina works providing cleaning services to different houses in a neighborhood with families with high levels of financial resources, and her husband works in the same way by doing swimming-pool maintenance for these same families.  Until a short time ago, they have been living in a rented house where the rental price was very high, so they decided to build their own home on a plot of land which was inherited from Señora Celina's father.  Bit by bit they are doing construction, as they have the main shell of the house and lack the money to purchase the materials for doing the detailed work.  Thus this loan will be destined for the purchase of said materials; although the house wasn't completely finished, they already moved in.

Señora Celina's dreams and goals are to fully complete construction on her house, where her children will be able to live comfortably with each one having their own room.

loans.use: to purchase construction material.

loans.name: Irakli

texts.en:
Irakli is thirty years old. He is married and lives with his wife Irma, their two-year-old son and his mother. Irakli’s wife is a housewife. His mother is busy with the family pig-farm, which is the only source of the income for the family. There is one pig on the farm and Irakli’s mother sells on average 10 piglets per year. The total average monthly income of the family is 350 Laris. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the vulnerable poor category. 

Irakli is a joiner. He has a workshop, where he used to produce various items of furniture, mainly chairs. Irakli stopped working 6 months ago, as he didn’t have money to purchase the wooden materials for production. He couldn’t get credit from local finance institutions, because of the family’s low income. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-start-up credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit Irakli will purchase materials for the workshop. He will re-start production of chairs and sell them through networks that he already knows; mainly in furniture stores in nearby towns. The income of the family will increase by approximately 110% and they will be able to improve their living conditions. Irakli also plans to reinvest part of the profit in the workshop, so he can diversify the products he makes. In addition to the above-mentioned, in the future Irakli will have enough income to access regular credit products available on country’s capital market, in case of need.

loans.use: to purchase materials for furniture production.

loans.name: Ps  Femme Casamancaise Group

texts.fr:
le banc villageois a été créé depuis le 02/09/2008.il est composé de femmes habitant le même quartier.
elle son unies par des liens sociaux et font toutes le commerce.
Madame Sounkarou est une femme marié âgée de 36 ans et mère de 6 enfants dont 3 garçons et 3 filles .
Elle fait du commerce de bois de chauffe depuis son entre dan le banc villageois.
Son nouveau crédit d 250000f lui permettra d'acheter des charrettes de bois  quelle va revendre dans le quartier.
Avec ses bénéfices elle prend en charge sa famille et renforce ses épargnes au niveau du banc villageois.
texts.en:
This "banc villageois" was created on 02/09/2008. It is made up of women who live in the same neighborhood. They are united by social networks and connections and are all businesswomen. 

Madame Sounkarou is a married woman of 36 and mother of six children, three boys and three girls. She has been selling firewood ever since she joined the "banc villageois". Her new loan of 250,000 francs will allow her to buy some wagon loads of wood which she will resell in her neighborhood. With her profit, she will support her family and put aside savings through her "banc villageois".

loans.use: to buy firewood.

loans.name: Manitos Magicas Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Manitos Mágicas” está conformado por 18 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran ; negocios, venta de frutas y verduras, venta de joyas, peluquería, venta de ropa, repostería, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos perteneciente a la comuna de Chiguayante ubicada en la ciudad de Concepción.
Katty, forma parte del Banco Comunal como presidenta, quien en la foto se encuentra en el recuadro superior izquierdo. Ella se dedica al rubro de artesanía en tejidos, se ocupa de este negocio desde hace 7 años, trabaja de lunes a viernes ella es quíen a veces se dirige a los domicilios particulares de sus clientes.
La mercadería que va necesitando la compra en la ciudad de Concepción y otras veces en la ciudad de Puerto Montt.
Con crédito comprará  lanas.
Las metas en su negocio son tener un local propio para una mejor atención a su clientela.
Katty vive junto a su marido y sus 4 hijos y uno de sus sueños son realizarse como mujer y dar una muy buena educación a sus hijos.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio. Además se siente muy cómoda con la compañía de las demás emprendedoras del grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que comparten diferentes actividades, intereses, lo cual también le ha servido como un momento de distracción. Respecto a las capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones, ha aprendido administra su negocio de mejor manera.
Chiguayante es una comuna ubicada al sur de Chile, cerca de la ciudad de Concepción, región del Biobío. Su nombre proviene del mapudungun (lengua mapuche) y significa “sol entre neblina”. Debido a su entorno montañoso posee un clima templado oceánico. Su actividad económica es principalmente comercial. Chiguayante había sido creada como comuna el año 1925, pero por diversas razones se unió luego a Concepción. Su existencia en esa época duró menos de dos años. El año 1996 se crea nuevamente como comuna, existiendo hasta el día de hoy.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Manitos Mágicas” (Magic Hands), and is made up of 18 entrepreneurs who work in various sectors, including selling fruit and vegetables, jewelry, clothing, pastries, a hair salon and other services. They are all from the Chiguayante commune, located in the city of Concepción.

Katty belongs to the comunal bank and is the chairperson. In the photo she is seen in the box at the upper left. She works in the woven handicraft sector and has run her business for seven years. She works Mondays to Friday. She is the one who sometimes goes to visit her customers' homes.

She buys the merchandise she needs in the city of Concepción, and other times in the city of Puerto Montt. With the loan she will buy wool. Her business goals are to have her own shop for better serving her clientele.

Katty lives with her husband and her four children, and one of her dreams is to fulfill herself as a woman and to give her children a very good education.

She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity that Fondo Esperanza has offered her, as it has allowed her to invest in her business. As well, she feels very comfortable in the company of the other entrepreneurs in the communal bank group, as they share various activities and interests. It has also served as an enjoyable activity for her. With the training provided in the meetings she has learned to run her business better.

Chiguayante is a commune located in the south of Chile, near the city of Concepción, in Biobío region. Its name comes from mapudungun (mapuche language) and means “sun through mist". Due to its mountainous surroundings it has a temperate maritime climate. Its economic activity is mainly commercial.

Chiguayante had been created as a commune in 1925, but for various reasons it later joined with Concepción. Its existence in that period lasted less than two years. In 1996 it was again created as a commune, and remains so to the present day.

loans.use: To buy wool.

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo lives in the village of Lapankuri, Kakheti Region. He is fifty-seven years old, single, and lives alone. Romeo works as a watchman in a local private dairy farm. His monthly salary is 100 Laris. Romeo owns 0.6 hectares of land, where he grows maize. In the spring and summer months he works hard on his cornfield during daytime and in the evening he goes to the farm, where he stays till morning. According the Credo estimations he belongs to the vulnerable poor category. 

Romeo needs money to purchase fertilizers for the cornfield. He tilled the land in April and sowed maize. If he doesn’t use fertilizers, he will get a low quality harvest and will have to sell it for cheap price, which won’t bring any profit. Romeo will also use some part of the credit to purchase piglets to set-up a small pig farm. He wasn’t able to receive the requested loan from local financial institutions, because his income was too small to qualify for regular loan products. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-start-up credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit Romeo will purchase fertilizers and use them in the cornfield. He will work hard on the plot during the summer to get good harvest. After selling the harvest, Romeo will get profit. Also his piglets will grow and in 7-8 months he will already have 2 pigs, which will give him approximately 18 piglets per year for sale. Romeo will have his own business and his monthly income will significantly improve. The Kiva start-up loan will allow him to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for the cornfield and piglets to start-up a pig farm

loans.name: Silbina

texts.es:
La señora Silbina tiene 45 años, está casada con el señor Antonio de 52 años. Ella nos cuenta que tiene una despensa en su casa desde hace 11 años, está bien surtida, aparte se dedica a la cría de animales (cerdos, gallinas y ganado vacuno), también le ayuda su marido en todo lo que ella hace.
Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y con ganas de salir adelante y ayudar a su familia, ya que sabe que la vida esta dura y la única forma de salir delante es trabajando.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de azúcar, gaseosas, lácteos, golosinas y demás insumos, con los que desea surtir su negocio y seguir dando de esa forma buenos productos a sus clientes,
texts.en:
Silbina is 45, and is married to Antonio, 52. She tells us that she has had a grocery store in her home for 11 years. It is well stocked. In addition, she raises animals (pigs, chickens, cattle), and her husband helps her in everything she does.

She is a very hard-working person, eager to succeed and help her family, as she knows that life is hard, and working is the only way to get ahead.

She is applying for the loan in order to buy soft drinks, dairy products, candy, and other supplies that she wishes to supply her business with, and to continue providing good products to her customers.

loans.use: To buy products for stocking her grocery store.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
La señora Sandra  de 37  años de edad, es comerciante y su esposo es el Sr. Norman de 36 años, de profesión docente universitario y abogado, tienen una hija de 7 años que va a la escuela.
Se inicio en el mercado de ventas gracias a la ayuda de su marido, quien cuenta con salario fijo, empezó con la venta de calzados, poco a poco fue aumentando su venta ya que su local queda cerca del centro comercial más concurrido de la ciudad. Actualmente además de calzados tiene prendas de vestir exclusivas para niños, como vestiditos, conjuntitos de jeans, camperitas, buzos y otros. Necesita de este crédito para  la compra de prendas de vestir y calzados de temporada, con lo cual podrá seguir trabajando y ganando más clientes
texts.en:
37-year-old Sandra is a saleswoman.  She is married to 36-year-old Norman who is a university professor and lawyer.  The couple have a 7-year-old daughter who attends school.  

Sandra started her sales business with the help of her husband who earns a regular salary.  She started out selling footwear and gradually increased her sales as her business premises are located near the busiest commercial center in the city.  Now, in addition to footwear, Sandra also sells children's clothing such as little dresses, denim outfits, jackets, sportswear, etc.  She needs this loan to buy seasonal clothing and footwear.  This will enable her to continue working and attracting more customers.

loans.use: to buy clothing and footwear

loans.name: Santa Librada Group

texts.es:
10 mujeres de la ciudad de Caacupé se han unido con las ganas de salir adelante y trabajar juntas, y por medio de ese trabajo ayudar a sus familias. Ellas son jefas de familia, que tienen a su cargo mantener y apoyar a sus familias.
 Digna es la presidenta del grupo, y nos comenta que se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de dulces, los cuales ella misma hace. Ella se define a si misma como una persona muy trabajadora, que lucha por su familia, ya que quiere darles todo lo que ella no pudo tener.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de materias primas para hacer los dulces que vende,  y de esa forma poder seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Ten women from the city of Caacupé have joined together because of their drive to succeed and the desire to work together. In this manner, they will be able to help their families. They are the heads of their households and in charge of sustaining and supporting their families.

Digna is the group president. She says that she sells all types of sweets that she prepares herself. Digna defines herself as a hardworking person who strives for her family because she wants them to have everything that she was not able to have. She is requesting a loan in order to buy supplies for making sweets that she will sell. This will enable her to continue working.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making sweets.

loans.name: Irakli

texts.en:
Irakli is twenty-seven years old. He is married and lives in the village of Ikalto, East Georgia. He is married and lives with his wife Alisa, their one-year-old son and Irakli's grandfather who is a pensioner. Irakli works as a baker in a local Georgian traditional bread-bakery. His monthly salary depends on the amount of bread baked during the month. On average he gets 300 Laris per month. Alisa is mainly busy with her little son. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category.

Irakli plans to start-up a pig farm, but he doesn’t have enough financial resources. He tried to get credit from several local finance institutions, but was refused, because of the family’s low income, which makes him “a risky client”. Irakli’s loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-start-up credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With the received credit Irakli will purchase 10 piglets. He will grow them and sell the grown piglets at a higher price. Irakli will get more income. He plans to reinvest it in the same business and purchase more piglets. He will expand his business. The family will get additional income and they will be able to provide better care for their little son, as well as other family members. In addition to the above-mentioned, in the future Irakli will have enough income to access regular credit products available on the country’s capital market, in case of need.

loans.use: to purchase piglets.

loans.name: Elvio

texts.es:
El Sr. Elvio tiene  64 años, está casado con la sra. Juana  de 62 años, tienen 6 hijos, todos ya mayores e independientes.
El Sr. Elvio se dedica a la carpintería hace 15 años aproximadamente, en su casa tiene un taller, que empezó trabajando con toda su familia, hace tres años que comenzó la venta de muebles por la zona de Asunción y  Caaguazú y ahora está trabajando sobre pedidos.
Solicito de este crédito para la compra de más materia prima para la elaboración de muebles, como ser maderas, clavos, barniz y demás, ya que son materiales muy necesarios para que siga trabajando.
texts.en:
Elvio is 64, and married to Juana, 62. They have six children, who are all now adults and independent.

Elvio has been a carpenter for appoximately 15 years. He has a workshop in his home that he started by working with his entire family. Three years ago, he started selling furniture in the Asunción and Caaguazú areas, and now he is doing custom orders.

He applied for the loan in order to buy more raw material for making furniture, such as wood, nails, varnish and other supplies. These are very necessary materials for him to keep working.

loans.use: To buy wood, nails, varnish and other supplies.

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El comité cuenta con 16 integrantes, las mismas son de la  ciudad de Caacupé.Las mujeres de este comité cuentan con actividades variadas e invirtien sus créditos para el sustento de sus negocios. Todas las integrantes estan muy agradecidas con la Fundacion Paraguaya y  kiva por el valioso apoyo que les brinda para poder mejorar sus ingresos y asi tambien su calidad de vida.
La Sra. Mirtha es la presidenta de su grupo, y comenta que gracias a su grupo y al apoyo de sus amigas y compañeras ha podido mejorar su negocio y salir adelante. Ella se dedica a la cría y venta de pollos, en lo que le va muy bien ya que tiene una buena clientela.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de alimento para sus animales, ya que desea tener varia cantidad para que no les falte.
texts.en:
This committee has 16 members, who are from the city of Caacupé.  The women of this committee take part in various activities and invest their loans in sustaining their businesses.  All the members are very grateful to the Fundacion Paraguaya and to Kiva for the valuable support that they give them in improving their income and so also their quality of life.

Señora Mirta is the president of the group, and she comments that thanks to her group and the support of her friends and companions, she has been able to improve her business and move ahead in life.  She works raising and selling chickens, which is going very well for her as she has a good customer base.

She is requesting a loan for the purchase of feed for her poultry, as she she wants to have a good quantity so that they don't lack food.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her poultry.

loans.name: Mirna Azucena

texts.es: La Sra. Mirna Azucena de 31 años, casada  tiene  3 hijos de los  cuales 2 de ellos estan cursando la educacion  primaria, vive en casa de renta y se dedica a la venta de nopales y productos de catalago como los son perfumes, cosmeticos, artculos para el hogar,ropa interior y mas, a esta actividad se dedica desde hace 3 años, su esposo trabaja como encargado de un yonque en el cual ya cuenta con una antigüedad de 2 años. Su sueño como familia es comprar una casa para poder brindarles un patrimonio a sus hijos. La Sra. Mirna solicita solicita el apoyo para el enganche de un carro y de esta manera expander la venta de nopales y los productos que ella vende en mas colonias y poder obtener ingresos mayores para poder ir ahorrando y comprar la casa que tanto anelan para sus hijos.
texts.en: Mirna Azucena is 31 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom are attending elementary school.  She lives in a rental house and her business is selling nopales (the edible pads of the prickly pear cactus) and also catalog products such as perfumes, cosmetics, household items, underwear, etc.  She has been in this business for three years.  Her husband works as a manager at a scrap yard.  He has been working there for two years.  Their dream as a family is to buy a house so that they can provide their children with an inheritance.  Mirna is requesting support so that she can make a down payment on a car.  This will enable her to expand her sales business and start selling her nopales and other products in more districts.  She will thereby be able to make more income so that she can save and buy the house that she and her husband long to give their children.

loans.use: to make a down payment on a car

loans.name: Rosaura

texts.es: La señora Rosaura es originaria de Granada, soltera, de oficio comerciante se dedica a la elaboración de trajes para niñas, bautizos ,comuniones, es modista una de las actividades que más se dedican las mujeres de la ciudad de Granada, ha trabajado con el apoyo de crédito otorgados por nuestra institución este es su segundo crédito Kiva el primero lo utilizo para comprar telas, hilo, agujas, todos los insumos necesarios para elaborar sus vestidos el cual estima fue de mucha ayuda ya que invirtió mas en su negocio incrementando sus ventas. Actualmente solicita el crédito al igual para comprar telas, hilos, encajes, agujas para elaborar trajes alusivos al mes de las madres, en el negocio recibe el apoyo de su hermana, sus diseños son elaborados acorde a cada temporada esto hace mantener su cliente y variar en diseños por lo tanto sus ganancias se mantienen, sus planes futuros son seguir trabajando con el apoyo de créditos para invertir en un segundo negocio que seria la venta de cosméticos y luchar por conseguir hacer un taller con maquinas semi industriales.
texts.en: Rosaura is from Granada and she is unmarried.  She is a merchant by trade and makes baptism and communion outfits for children.  Dress-making is one of the activities most engaged in by women in Grenada.  Rosaura has worked with the help of credit granted by our institution and this is her second Kiva loan.  She used the first loan to purchase fabric, thread, needles, and all the supplies she needed to make her garments.  She feels the loan was a great help because it enabled her to invest more in her business and increase her sales. Now, she is requesting a similar loan to purchase fabric, thread, lace, and needles to make dresses for Mother’s Day.  Her sister helps her with the business and Rosaura creates her designs according to each season.  Varying her designs helps her maintain her customers and, consequently, her profits.  Her future plans include continuing to work and, with the support of the loans, to invest in a second business selling cosmetics and to strive for a workshop with semi-industrial sewing machines.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, thread, lace, and needles to make outfits for Mother's Day.

loans.name: La Victoria Group

texts.es:
El Comite La Victoria es del Chaco, esta en su primer ciclo y todas las mujeres de este grupo están empezando a trabajar juntas y por medio de ese trabajo desean ayudarse y a la vez ayudar a sus familias.
Rosalba es una de las miembros de este grupo, ella se dedica a la costura hace ya un tiempo, y comenta que gracias al buen trabajo que hace ha podido formarse una buena clientela que siempre acude a ella a darle trabajos. Su meta es poder seguir trabajando y tener un gran taller.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, hilos, gomas y demás insumos que necesite para poder seguir trabajando en su taller de costura
texts.en:
The committee known as "La Victoria" is from Chaco. The group is in its first loan cycle and all of the women are starting to work together. By doing this, they will be able to help one another and their families.

Rosalba is one of the members of the group. She has been a seamstress for some time. Rosalba says that thanks to the good work that she produces, she has been able to establish a good clientele. Her customers are always giving her work. Rosalba's goals are to continue working and to have a larger workshop. She is requesting a loan in order to buy fabrics, thread, rubber, and other supplies that she needs in order to keep her sewing workshop in operation.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread, rubber, and other supplies.

loans.name: Kuña Pora Group

texts.es:
El comité esta compuesto por 11  integrantes en la ciudad de Encarnación. El comité ya tiene un poco de experiencia en trabajo grupal, ya que trabajan juntas para poder salir adelante y ayudarse las unas a las otras.
Una de las integrantes, Fatima, está acompañada con Juan, con quien tiene 4 hijos. Fátima tiene una casilla y con los ingresos que ella tiene ayuda a su marido en los gastos de su hogar, ya que sabe que mantener la casa es muy difícil. El sueño de ella es poder seguir trabajando y algún día tener un gran negocio.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de gaseosas, golosinas, galletitas, jugos y demás productos, ya que quiere surtir su negocio de esa forma.
texts.en:
This committee is based in the city of Encarnación and has eleven members.  The committee already has some experience of working as a group because they work together in order to make progress and help each other out.

One of the members, Fátima, lives together with her partner Juan.  The couple have four children.  Fátima has a stall and she uses the income she makes to help her husband with their household expenses as she knows that supporting their household is very difficult.  Her dream is to be able to continue working and, some day, to have an important business.

Fátima is requesting this loan to buy soda, candies, cookies, juice and other products as she would like to stock her business.

loans.use: to buy soda, candies, cookies, juice and other products

loans.name: Jose Guadalupe

texts.es:
El Sr. José Guadalupe de 34 años, cuenta con su negocio de Reparación y Venta de Lavadoras desde hace 2 años 9 meses,  su esposa y sus dos hijos, le han brindado todo su apoyo para que el negocio salga adelante día con día. El decidió formar este negocio debido a que sus padres fueron la principal motivación ya que actualmente cuentan con un negocio de Reparación y Venta de Lavadoras en el cual él les ayudo por varios años hasta que el decidió ser dueño de su propio negocio su papá le apoyo regalándole 5 lavadoras para que el pudiera iniciar lo que hoy es su negocio.
Actualmente cuenta con un buen numero de clientes, debido al buen trabajo que realiza y sus clientes están muy satisfechos con el trato que el y su familia les brinda. Solicita el apoyo para compra de lavadoras en buenas condiciones para poderlas vender y para la compra de piezas para reparar lavadoras.
texts.en:
José Guadalupe is 34 years old, and he has owned and operated a laundry machine repair and sales business for the past 2 years and 9 months. His wife and two children have given him their full support, and want to see the business succeed. He decided to start this business as a direct result of his parents’ work over the years in their own similar business. He learned much about the trade from them when he worked for them for many years. When he decided to open his own business, his father gave him five washing machines as a gift to help get him started.

Presently, José has a sizeable customer base, since he does high quality work and his clients are very happy with how he treats both them and their machines. He is requesting this loan in order to purchase washing machines in good condition so that he can resell them. He also plans to use part of this loan to purchase spare parts for repairing washing machines.

loans.use: to purchase spare washing machine parts.

loans.name: Shirley Lorena

texts.es:
SHIRLEY LORENA tiene 29 años de edad es soltera tiene un hijo, vive con el hijo de 11 años de edad en Ventanas provincia de los ríos.

SHIRLEY LORENA es secretaria en una Institución. Solicita el crédito para comprar barilla, cemento, cementina, arena. 

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los materiales para poder realizar realizar el mejoramientoi de vivienda.

Las compras lo hara en Ventanas. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es poder agrandar la casa.
El sueño es poder tener el titulo de contador para ejercer la profesión. En el tiempo libre le gusta dormir, leer.
texts.en:
Shirley Lorena is 29 years old, single, and has one child. She lives with her 11-year-old son in Ventanas, which is located in Los Ríos Province.

Shirley Lorena is a secretary at an institution. She is requesting a loan in order to buy rods, cement, porcelain tiles, and sand. With the help of this loan, she will be able to buy the materials she needs for improving her home. The purchases will be made in Ventanas. The challenges she faces include being able to expand her house. Her dream is to earn a degree in Accounting so that she can pursue that profession.

In her free time, Shirley likes to sleep and read.

loans.use: to buy rods, cement, porcelain tiles, and sand.

loans.name: Susana Zoila

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de tienda de abarrotes,la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azucar,leche y galletas,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,por medio de este negociola socia saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes.La socia solicita el credito para comprar arroz,azucar,leche y galletas al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Susana operates a general store, and sells basic products such as: rice, sugar, milk, cookies and crackers. She works from 8:00 am until 5:00 pm, and this job helps her to provide for her children. She hopes to expand and improve her business, and she is therefore requesting this loan in order to purchase merchandise in bulk for her store, such as: rice, sugar, milk, cookies, crackers, etc.

Susana is grateful for the support, and promises to follow through with loan payments.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, milk, cookies and crackers in bulk.

loans.name: Arsen

texts.ru: Арсен трудолюбивый и добросовестный человек. Более 35 лет он занимается предоставлением услуги перевозкой пассажиров. Раньше работал в государственном учреждении, а потом купил КАМАЗ и начал работать предоставлять услуги в области. Его КАМАЗ нуждается в ремонте с этой целью запрашивает займ для капитального ремонта и покраски кабины своего КАМАЗ-а. Он надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en:
Arsen is a hardworking and conscientious person. For the past 35 years, he's made a living by transporting passengers. He used to work in a government agency, but then bought a KAMAZ truck and began working in his area. His KAMAZ is in need of repair and, thus, he's asking for loan in order to repair his truck and repaint the cabin. 
He hopes for your help and charity.

loans.use: To repair his truck.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La Sra. Maria tiene su taller de costura en Ciudad del Este, donde trabaja arduamente cada día para poder cumplir con los pedidos de todos sus clientes.
Ella solicita el crédito a Fundación Paraguaya y a kiva para poder comprar telas diversas y algunos materiales que necesita de manera urgente para cumplir con un importante pedido de uniformes para  la temporada de invierno.
La Señora se define a sí misma como una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, que desea poder trabajar y de esa forma seguir ayudando a su familia por medio de su trabajo.
texts.en:
Maria has her sewing workshop in Ciudad del Este, where she works hard each day to be able to fulfill the orders of all her customers.

She is applying to Fundación Paraguaya and to Kiva for the loan, to be able to buy different fabrics and some materials she urgently needs in order to fill an important uniform order for the winter season. 

María defines herself as a very hard-working and enterprising person, who wishes to be able to work, and that way keep helping her family through her work.

loans.use: To buy fabric and other supplies.

loans.name: Casimiro Refugio

texts.es: El Sr. Refugio un hombre trabajador, responsable, y con 40 años de antigüedad en su labor. Es dueño de un conocido taller de enderezado y pintura. El Sr. Refugio es un hombre casado, su esposa es ama de casa y lo apoya en su negocio, los dos juntos han logrado tener un patrimonio sólido, en estos momentos el taller del Sr. Refugio esta teniendo mucha demanda y esta en muy buenos tiempos de trabajo. Ya que su negocio es su única fuente de ingresos para sostener su casa, su negocio, y mas que nada a su familia. Solicita crédito para compra de material para su negocio y así el podrá tener mas eficiencia en su labor tener mas clientes y obtener mayores ingresos para el y su familia.
texts.en: Refugio is a hardworking and responsible man who has 40 years of experience in his work.  He owns a well-known auto body shop.  Refugio is a married man, and his wife is a housewife who supports him with his business.  Together, the two of them have managed to have a solid marriage.  Right now there is a lot of demand for his work.  Times are good for his business, which is his only source of revenue to support his household, his business, and most of all his family.  He is requesting a loan to buy supplies for his business, so that he can be more efficient with labor, have more customers, and have a better income for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy tools for his body shop

loans.name: Dalmecia

texts.es:
La socia Dalmecia pertenece al banco comunal CAMINEMOS JUNTAS,la socia continua con su negocio de elaboracion de  collares y aretes a base de semillas naturales,la socia trabaja de forma ambulatoria vendiendo su mercaderia a sus clientes que le solicitan, La socia lleva buen tiempo en este su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia.

La socia solicita el prestamo para la compra de semillas de frutos para su negocio de venta de collares y aretes.

La socia se siente agradecida por el prestamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Dalmecia is a member of the 'Caminemos Juntas' community bank.  She continues in her business making necklaces and earrings from natural seeds.  She works as an itinerant street  vendor, selling her merchandise to customers who request it.  She has been in this business for a long time and it is going well thanks to the hard work that she puts in every day.

Dalmecia is requesting this loan to buy fruit seeds for her business selling necklaces and earrings.

Dalmecia is grateful for the loan she is receiving and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy fruit seeds for her business making and selling necklaces and earrings

loans.name: Shirley

texts.es: Shirley, tiene la edad  de 31 años, está casada, vive con sus hijos y esposo  que son su mayor prioridad. Ella con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de abonos foliares, fertilizantes, fungicidas y pagar mano de obra para la asistencia de café, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar una buena aplicación de productos y hacer un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de suelo y topografía que cuenta la propiedad para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia en el manejo de café. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad, y tener en este periodo una producción adecuada. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Shirley is 31 years old, married, and lives with her children and spouse, who are her main priority.  With her credit, she plans to buy leaf mulch, fertilizers, fungicides, and pay a day laborer to help with the coffee, and in this way ensure a good application of the products and do a good job of it.

What she hopes is to take advantage of the good soil conditions and topography which the land has for this type of cultivation, and also to put her experience with coffee growing into practice.  Besides being able to buy the best products, she will use those of the best quality to ensure that her plantation will have good and healthy growth and to have a sufficient level of production in this growing season.

This is the first loan she has received from FUDECOSUR.  She has never taken out a loan from a state bank before, but FUDECOSUR has offered her a loan with ease and at a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to care for her coffee.

loans.name: Sayhua Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SAYHUA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maricel ella es conviviente y tiene 32 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja con su negocio de crianza de animales, ella cría pollos y cuyes y los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en forma ambulatoria en las distintas ferias, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de crianza de animales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar pollos y cuyes.
Los socios que estan pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo despues porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de alquiler de habitaciones, negocio de tienda de abarrotes, negocio de venta de comida y negocio de crianza de animales.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the community bank "Sayhua".  This bank is located in the Urubamba district belonging to the Urubamba province and department of Cuzco.

Mrs. Maricel is a member, lives with her spouse, is 32 years old and has one child.  She works in her business of raising animals, she raises chickens and guinea pigs, gets them to grow and fatten up and then sells them at the various fairs.  The member works from 8:00 am until 6:00 pm and through this business gets her child ahead.  She wants to enlarge and improve her business of raising animals.  She is requesting this loan to buy chickens and guinea pigs.

The member photos that are attached to the group picture were taken later since the members were excused because of work commitments.
The other members have a room rental business, a grocery store, food sales business and animal raising business.

The member thanks all that are part of this dream and promises to make her payments in the established time period.

loans.use: to purchase chickens and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La socia sigue perteneciendo al banco comunal “VIRGEN CONCEBIDA DE ARIN”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Arin en la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es comerciante minorista, ella se sigue dedicándose a la compra y venta de verduras, la socia también tiene un terreno de cultivo donde siembra todo tipo de verduras y lleva sus verduras a vender una comunidad cerca de donde vive. En esta oportunidad la socia requiere el préstamo para comprar, abono,  semillas, pesticidas y otras cosas más.  

La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
This member continues to belong to the community bank "Virgen Concebida de Arin".  The community bank is located in the Arin district of the Calca province of the department of Cuzco.

The member is a retail merchant. She buys and sells vegetables.   She also has a plot of land where she grows all types of vegetables.  She sells these vegetables in a community close to where she lives.  At this time, the member is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, seeds, pesticides and other supplies.

The member is very grateful for the loan and promises to repay according to the payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, pesticides and other supplies.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicndo al negocio de venta de artesania,la socia vende chompas,polos,guantes y sombreros,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de artesania.La socia solicita el credito para comprar artesania como mantas, chompas,polos,sombreros y guantes.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Zenaida is continuing with her business selling handicrafts.  She sells sweaters, polo shirts, gloves and hats.  She works from 8am until 6pm, and through this business she provides for her children.  Her dream is to expand her handicraft business.  She is requesting a loan to buy hand-made items such as blankets, sweaters, polo shirts, hats and gloves.

Zenaida is pleased to be getting this loan, and she promises to comply with the payment terms.

loans.use: to buy blankets, sweaters, polo shirts, hats and gloves

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de artesania,el socio vende chompas,mantas y ceramicas,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio el socio quiere sacar adelante a sus hijos,el sueño del socio es ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de artesania.El socio solicita el credito para comprar artesanias como chompas,mantas y ceramicas al por mayor.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member is still working at his business selling artisanal crafts. He sells sweaters, blankets and ceramics. He works from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m. With this business, he wants to get his children ahead. His dream is to expand and improve his business selling artisanal crafts. He is asking for the loan to buy artisanal crafts such as sweaters, blankets and ceramics wholesale. 

He is happy with the loan and committed to making his payments on time.

loans.use: to buy artisanal crafts such as sweaters, blankets and ceramics wholesale.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
El socio Luis Alberto pertenece al banco comunal CAMINEMOS JUNTAS;el socio continua trabajando brindando el servicio de taxi, por el centro de la ciudad,el socio trabaja todos los dias desde las 06:00am hasta las 10:00pm aproximadamente,el socio es una persona alegre y responsable con muchas ganas de salir adelante por su familia.

El socio solicita el prestamo para comprar llantas y para el mantenimiento de su carro.

El socio se siente agradecido por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Luis Alberto belongs to the communal bank "Caminemos Juntas."  He continues to work as a taxi driver in the center of the city.  He works every day from 6am until about 10pm.  He is a happy and responsible person who has a strong desire to get ahead with his family.

He is requesting a loan to buy tires and to do some maintenance work on his car.

He appreciates the loan that is being granted to him, and he promises to comply with the payment terms of the loan.

loans.use: to buy tires and do some maintenance work on his car

loans.name: Carolina Enriqueta

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de manualidades,ella hace trabajos como cuadros,manteles y toallas y luego los vende en las diferentes colegios y tiendas,la socia vende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia quiere salira adelante,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender las manualidades.La socia solicita el credito para comprar telas,pinturas y lanas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member continues to work in the business of selling crafts.  She makes pictures, tablecloths and towels and sells them at the various schools and stores. She sells from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm and through this work she plans to get ahead.  Her dream is to have a store where she can sell her crafts.  She is requesting the loan to purchase cloth, paints and yarn.

She is very happy to get the loan and promises to comply with the repayment agreement.

loans.use: to buy cloth, paints and yarn.

loans.name: Rosalio

texts.es:
El socio Rosalio pertenece al banco comunal CAMINEMOS JUNTAS,el socio continua brindando el servicio de taxi el trabaja todos los dias desde las 06:00am hasta las 10:00pm aproximadamente ,el socio trabaja por el centro de la ciudad ,el socio es una persona alegre y responsable con muchas ganas de salir adelante por su familia.

El socio solicita el prestamo para que pase revision tecnica su carro.

El socio se siente agradecido por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Rosalio belongs to the CAMINEMOS JUNTAS [Let's Walk Together] communal bank. He continues to offer his taxi service. He works every day from 6:00 a.m. until approximately 10:00 p.m. He works in the center of town and is a cheerful and responsible person who really wants to get his family ahead.  

Rosalio is asking for the loan so that his car can pass a mechanical check. 

He is grateful for the loan he has been given and committed to making his payments on time.

loans.use: so that his car can pass a mechanical check.

loans.name: Mirzokosim

texts.ru: Мирзокосим трудолюбивый и доброй души человек, он женат и на воспитании имеет одного ребенка, которому 3 года. Жена занимается домохозяйством и присматривает за ребенком. Его родители также живут с ним. Более 6 лет Мирзокосим занимается купле- продажей и откормом крупного рогатого скота. Данный момент имеет 7 голов крупного рогатого скота. Мирзокосим кредитуется в «ИМОН Интернешнл» уже второй раз. Первый раз он получил 5000 сомони для расширения своего бизнеса и своевременно погашал свой займ. Новый займ он хочет получить для закупа корма для скота. В бизнесе помогает ему вся семья. Мирзокосим надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en:
Mirzokosim is a hardworking and kind person. He's married and has one three-year-old son. Mirzokosim's wife takes care of their household and child. His parents live with them. 
For the past six years, Mirzokosim has made a living buying, fattening and selling large-horned cattle. Currently, he has 7 heads of cattle. This is his second loan via "IMON International". His first loan consisted of 5,000 somoni intended for expanding his business. That loan was repaid in time. 
He's asking for a second loan in order to purchase some feed for his cattle. His family helps him run the business. Mirzokosim hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: To buy cattle feed.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La socia Juana pertenece al banco comunal CAMINEMOS JUNTAS;la socia continua con el negocio de venta de artesanía como chompas,chalinas,guantes,gorros,polos entre otros,a la vez la socia elabora algunos adornos ,la socia trabaja de forma ambulatoria repartiendo su mercaderia a sus clientes que le solicitan,la socia es una persona alegre y responsable con muchas ganas de salir adelante por su familia.

La socia solicita el prestamo para la compra de mercaderia para su negocio como polos.

La socia se siente agradecida por el prestamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: Juana belongs to the Caminemos Juntos Communal Bank.  She continues with her business selling artisanal crafts such as sweaters, scarves, gloves, hats, polo shirts, and other crafts.  She also makes some ornaments. Juana works as a street vendor and delivers her merchandise to customers who request it.  She is a happy, responsible person with a strong desire to help her family get ahead.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise, such as polo shirts, for her business.

loans.name: Cecilio

texts.es: Cecilio, tiene la edad  de 38 años, está casado, vive con sus hijos y esposa  que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de madera, cemento entre otros materiales y pagar mano de obra para los trabajos realizados, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar  precios bajos y tiempo disponible para realizar los trabajos de mejoras en la vivienda. Además de poder comprar los mejores materiales y hacer los trabajos lo más pronto posible. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Cecilio is 38 years old, and lives with his wife and children, who are his first priority. He plans to use the support from this loan to purchase wood, cement and other building materials, and to pay labor costs for the construction work involved in repairing his home. He hopes to take advantage of low prices and free time to complete repairs on his family’s house. This is his first loan from FUDECOSUR. He has not received other loans from state-run banks, and he chose FUDECOSUR because they offer lower interest rates and good borrower support.

loans.use: to repair his home.

loans.name: Irene

texts.es: La Sra. Irene se preocupa por su patrimonio y el bien estar de su hogar es una mujer trabajadora, pensionada y trabaja como empleada domestica desde hace aproximadamente dos años. Solicita crédito para reparaciones en su hogar, el problema es una fuga de agua en su medidor y necesita repararlo y este costo tiene que ser absorbido por ella; Irene agradecería el apoyo brindado ya que es una necesidad básica y esencial no solo para ella si no para todos.
texts.en: Irene worries about her property and the well-being of her home.  She is a hardworking woman who receives a pension and has also been working as a domestic for about 2 years.  She is requesting a loan to make some repairs to her house.  The problem is that there is water leaking from her meter and she has to repair it; she is the one who must absorb this cost.  Irene is grateful for the support provided, because this is a basic need, not only for her but for everyone.

loans.use: to repair a water leak

loans.name: Yhasmany

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de cigarrilos y tambien el socio trabaja en el area de seguridad,por medio de este negocio y trabajo el socio quiere salira adelante,el sueño del socio es tener un local donde pueda vender los cigarrillos.El socio solicita el credito para comprar cigarrillos al por mayor.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member is still working selling cigarettes and also still working in security services. Through this business and work the member wants to get ahead. His dream is to have a facility where he can sell cigarettes. He is asking for a loan in order to buy cigarettes at wholesale.

The member is happy for the loan and he promises to make his payments as agreed.

loans.use: to buy cigarettes at wholesale prices

loans.name: Nieves

texts.es:
La  socia  Nieves pertenece al banco comunal CAMINEMOS JUNTAS,la socia continua con su trabajo de vigilancia,ella trabaja en una empresa privada de lunes a sabado,la socia es muy querida en el barrio en el cual ella trabaja, a la vez la socia apoya a su pareja en su negocio de taxi ella le ayuda en el pago del mantenimiento de su carro.

La socia solicita el prestamo para apoyar a su pareja en la compra de llantas para su carro.

La socia se siente feliz con el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Nieves belongs to the CAMINEMOS JUNTAS [Let's Walk Together] communal bank. She continues to work diligently in a private business Monday through Saturday. She is very beloved in the neighborhood where she works. Nieves alsoo supports her spouse in his taxi business and is helping him pay for the maintenance on his car.

She is asking for the loan to help her spouse buy tires for his car.

Nieves is happy with the loan she has been given and committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to help her spouse buy tires for his car.

loans.name: Tamaz

texts.en:
Tamaz is 27 years old. He lives in the village of Lapankuri, East Georgia with his mother and 29 year old sister. Tamaz is currently unemployed. His sister works as a pharmacist in a local drugstore. Tamaz’s mother has chronic health problems and receives the relevant pension from the local government. Total average monthly income of the family is 400 Laris. According to Credo estimations the family belongs in the vulnerable poor category.

Tamaz needs a loan for sowing maize on the  family owned 0.5 hectare land and to start-up a pig farm. He couldn’t get regular agricultural credit from local financial institutions as the income of the family is too small. Tamaz’s loan request was approved because of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, which do not have access to credit products because they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received loan, Tamaz will purchase fertilizers, till the land, fertilize it and sow maize. He will work hard on the plot during the summer to get a good harvest. After selling the harvest, he will get profit. With part of the credit, Tamaz will also purchase a pig for setting up a pig farm. He will be able to sell piglets after four months. Through the above mentioned investment Tamaz’s income will increase and he will be able to improve the living conditions of the family. Also he will purchase medicines and medical services for his mother.

loans.use: to purchase a pig to start-up a pig farm and fertilizers for growing maize

loans.name: Teresa Isabel

texts.es: Teresa Isabel es casada con hijos menores de edad  su actividad, económica es la venta de mercadería general tiene varios años de venir trabajando con fundación león 2000 lo cual tiene mucha experiencia con los financiamientos  ha demostrado ser responsable, trabajadora, con solvencia moral,  ella siempre ha luchado por ser independiente económicamente  motivo por el cual inicio con su herramienta de trabajo lo cual fue con un poco de capital propio, en la actualidad ha incrementado sus ganancias y venta y clientela gracia al financiamiento que fundación león 2000 le ha brindado para la compra de productos como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas, calcetines, ropa interior, sabanas, entre otros.
texts.en: Teresa Isabel is married with young children.  She sells general merchandise and has been working with Fundación León 2000 for several years, so she has lots of experience with loans and has demonstrated that she is a responsible, hardworking, moral person.  She has always worked toward becoming financially independent, so she started with her few work tools and capital.  Now her income, sales, and customer base have been increasing, thanks to financing through Fundación León 2000.  It has allowed her to buy products like pants, blouses, shirts, socks, undergarments, sheets, among other things.

loans.use: to buy inventory for resale.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.es:
La socia Georgina pertenece al banco comunal CAMINEMOS JUNTAS ; la socia continua con su negocio de compra y venta de granos secos,como trigo, papa, cebada y moraya,entre otros ,la socia trabaja de forma ambulatoria repartiendo su mercaderia a sus clientes que le solicitan ,la socia lleva buen tiempo en este su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone a su negocio cada dia,la socia es una persona alegre y responsable con muchas ganas de continuar trabajando por su familia.

La socia solicita el prestamo para la compra de mercaderia para su negocio como maiz.

La socia se siente agradecida por el prestamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Georgina belongs to the "Caminemos Juntos" communal bank. The borrower is continuing with her business buying and selling staples such as wheat, potatoes, barley, dried potatoes and other products. 

She goes door-to-door distributing her merchandise to her customers who order from her. The borrower has been in this business for some time, and it is going well thanks to the effort she puts into her business each day. She is a cheerful and responsible person, eager to keep working for her family.

The borrower is applying for the loan in order to buy merchandise for her business, such as corn.

She feels grateful for the loan she has been granted, and promises to make her installment payments as agreed.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her business, such as corn.

loans.name: Andres Tovar

texts.es: Muchos alimentos para el consumo inmediato ha logrado vender Andrés y esto fue gracias a su anterior credikiva con el cual compró materias primas e insumos como arroz, aceite, tubérculos, cereales en mayor volumen. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva  el cual invertirá de dos maneras, por un lado hará adecuaciones a sus instalaciones productivas y necesitará materiales para la construcción y por otro lado comprará materias primas e insumos, anticipándose así, al incremento de los productos y ganando el costo de la oportunidad de adquirirlos de contado y en mas volumen que el acostumbrado. El envía el siguiente mensajes  a los financiadores de Kiva: " Estoy agradecido por la financiación de mi proyecto, ya que me dieron la oportunidad de incrementar la producción y los ingresos. "
texts.en: Andres has been able to sell many fast food products thanks to his previous Kiva loan with which he bought raw materials and supplies such as rice, oil, potatoes, cereals in large quantities.  Currently he is applying for a new Kiva loan which he will use in two ways: on one hand he is going to make improvements to his facilities and needs construction materials, and on the other hand, he will buy raw materials and supplies expecting an increase in products.  He can benefit from buying them with cash and in larger quantities than usual.  He sends the following message to the Kiva backers:  "I am very grateful for the financing of my project since you have given me the opportunity to increase my production and my income."

loans.use: to adapt his production facilities by being able to get construction materials, and also buy raw materials and supplies for food production.

loans.name: Matilde Vicenta

texts.es: Con su credikiva anterior Matilde compró materias prima y preparó muchos y deliciosos productos fritos que vendió rápidamente y aumentó ligeramente su capital de trabajo. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva con el cual comprará en mayor volumen, aceite, azúcar, sal, maíz y queso, porque ampliará su cobertura de productos y debe desarrollar una buena oferta para lograr la compra de sus clientes. Ella se siente muy satisfecha con sus financiaciones, porque ha logrado incrementar sus ventas y dice a sus financiadores de Kiva lo siguiente: “Me siento muy agradecida con el apoyo que me dieron y espero seguir respondiendo ante la deuda lo mejor posible”.
texts.en:
With her previous loan Matilde bought raw materials and made many delicious fried products.  They sold rapidly, and her working capital modestly increased.

She is currently applying for a new Kiva loan to buy oil, sugar, salt, corn, and cheese in greater volume.  She will do this to increase her product coverage.  She needs to develop a good offer in order to get her customers to purchase from her.

She is very pleased with her loan because she has managed to increase her sales.  To the Kiva lenders she says the following, “I am very grateful for the support you gave me.  I hope to continue handling the debt in the best way possible.”

loans.use: to buy supplies such as rice, sugar, flavorings, sausages, sauces, sugar, bread (hot dogs), bread (burgers), vegetables, meat and oil.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.es: Anthony de 28 años, tiene una experiencia emprendedora de hace 10 años, cuando aprendió de su madre también comerciante,  se dedica a la venta de carnes frías y la comercialización de artículos de cacharrería, lámparas, carcasas, celulares etc. Sus compras de carnes frías las realiza en el municipio de Galapa, donde habita con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos de 4 años y de dos meses de nacida. Las mercancías las adquiere en la ciudad de Barranquilla ubicada a 20 minutos de la ciudad. Así mismo sus principales clientes se encuentran en los municipios de Sabanalarga, Las Peñas, Aguada, San Pablo y  en el mismo Galapa. Sus ventas las realiza a crédito y sus clientes pagan en plazos entre 15 y 30 días; con sus ingresos proveniente de las ventas, sostiene su hogar y por eso quiere crecer, para proveer mucho mas bienestar y consolidar el futuro familiar. Su meta mas adelante  es tener un negocio más amplio y tener su propia casa para ubicarlo. Su mayor desafío es tener un capital de trabajo suficiente para comprar y ganar los precios de oportunidad, por eso está aplicando a un  credikiva, con el cual comprará carnes frías, y productos de cacharrería, este será su primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, de los mucho mas con los cuales aspira a crecer
texts.en: Anthony, 28, has 10 years of business experience.  He learned this trade from his mother, who is also a merchant.  He has a business selling cold cuts and also selling low cost novelty items, including flashlights, cell phone cases, cellular phones, etc.  He buys his cold cuts in the municipality of Galapa, where he lives with his wife and their two children aged 4 and 2 months.  He acquires his merchandise in the city of Barranquilla, located 20 minutes from his city.  Most of his customers are found in the municipalities of Sabanalarga, Las Peñas, Aguada, San Pablo, and also in Galapa.  He sells on credit, and his customers pay over a period of between 15-30 days.  With the income that comes from his sales, he supports his household.  For this reason, he wants to grow his business so that he can provide his family with greater comfort, and can strengthen his family's future.  For the future, his goal is to have his own house, where he could locate his expanded business.  His main challenge is having enough working capital to buy and take advantage of special pricing.  This is why he is applying for a Kiva loan.  He will use this loan to buy cold cuts and novelty products.  This will be his first loan from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and with this and many more loans in the future, he hopes to grow his business.

loans.use: to buy cold cuts and other products to sell

loans.name: Ramiro Jose

texts.es: EL señor Ramiro , es un humilde agricultor de la zona de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposa , la cual vende frutas y verduras para apoyarlo con los gastos del hogar , los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar la vivienda , sobre todo hacerla un poco más grande , don Ramiro desde hace varios años se dedica a los trabajos del campos , la mayor afectación que se le ha venido presentado son las plagas que invaden el cultivo , ya que él les aplica los venenos necesarios para combatir este problemas , pero no llega a exterminar totalmente la plaga . El préstamo lo necesita para comprar fertilizantes e insumos necesarios para la plantación de piña , ya que este es el único recurso económico con el cuenta para poder llevar el pan de cada día  a su hogar .
texts.en: Ramiro is a humble farmer.  He and his wife are from the Ticuantepe zone.  His wife sells fruits and vegetables to help him with the household expense.  Their future plans are to enlarge their home a bit.  Ramiro has been working in the fields for several years and his biggest challenges are the blights that invade the crops.  He applies the necessary treatments but they don’t eliminate all of the blights.  He needs this loan to buy fertilizers and necessary supplies to plant pineapples, since this is his only financial resource to provide the daily bread for his home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and supplies.

loans.name: Dorotea Del Carmen
