One of the members of this group is Mrs. Emiliana, she is 35 years old and works making and selling pies, cakes and king cakes. At first Emiliana sold dinners and chickens in her home with the help of Vision Fund (FRAC) and with her earnings she started selling pies. Some time later, her customers asked for cakes and Mrs. Emiliana noticed that they were delicious and her customers demanded more cakes and to sell them by the slice since they would buy from her each day. With the loan, Emiliana will buy more ingredients to make pies and cakes like flour, egg, milk, butter, fruits and meringue.

She is grateful to the foundation for helping her keep her small business growing.

The other members of the group are: Andrés Ángel- sells jewelry. Maricela- sells clothing. Elizabeth- sells clothing. Feliciano- sells food. Carmen- sells fish. Nancy Fabiola- sells chilies and seeds. Miriam del Carmen- sells food. María del Carmen- sells shoes.

They are all grateful to the Realidad foundation for helping them reach their dreams.

loans.use: buy more ingredients to make pies and cakes like flour, egg, milk, butter, fruits and meringue.

loans.name: Cristian

texts.es: Cristian de 21 años de edad es un joven productor musical y comerciante a la vez, él estudió la carrera de producción musical, como pocos lo hacen,  en una Corporación y para generar ingresos trabaja en ella, pues desde que inicó lo ha consierado como una buena oportunidad de negocio; también buscando opciones de financiar su tarea musical, empezó a ofrecer productos mediante guías especializadas, porque su sueño es tener un estudio especializado de música, para ser feliz y poder apoyar el bienestar de sus padres. Su meta es mejorar su estructura musical y responder a pedidos de mercancías, que llegaron en sus catálogos con descuentos, pero su capital de trabajo ante el cumplimiento de sus metas se traduce en un gran desafío. Actualmente está aplicando a un credikiva, con el cual lograr ensanchar su producción musical, mediante la configuración audiovisual, desde allì empezará objetivamente su camino hacia al ascenso de su gran meta como productor de musica.Microfonos, parlantes,para la acustica, equipo el nilcer control del volumen del CD que le manda a edictar ael cliente, hace fotoshop, caratula con fotos y publicidad
texts.en:
Cristian, age 21, is a young music producer and salesman as well.  He majors in musical production in school, though very few do so, at a Corporation and to bring in income, he works in the field. Ever since he started, he has considered it a good business opportunity; also looking for ways to finance his music work, he started to offer sales by catalog.  His dream is to have a specialized music studio to make himself happy and to help him support his family's well-being.

His goal is to improve his musical set-up and to respond to the demands of the market, which came at a discount through his catalogs, but his working capital stands as a large impediment to achieving his goals.  Currently, he is applying for a micro-loan, with which he will expand his musical production capabilities by means of an audiovisual configuration.  From there, he will really begin his road to achieving his greatest goal of becoming a music producer.  Microphones, speakers for the acoustics, software to control the volume of the CD that he sends for editing to the customer, which does Photoshop and cover art with photos and publicity.

loans.use: to buy microphones, speakers, and equipment and to invest in publicity.

loans.name: Costa Brava Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Costa Brava esta conformado y esta conformado por siete personas trabajadoras, originarias de la ciudad de Pinotepa Nacional, Oaxaca  donde la mayoría de las personas gente indígena que habla en idioma mixteco.

Una de las integrantes de este grupo es la señora Clemencia de cincuenta y ocho años de edad, se caracteriza por ser una señora trabajadora y humilde, que se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos en las noches, venta de refrescos y pescados frescos y asados. Dice que lleva con su negocio veinte años y lo que mas le gusta es hacer sus tortillas a mano. Cuenta que inició vendiendo atoles, tamales y aguas frescas en su casa y posteriormente decidió vender antojitos mexicanos con refrescos. Dice que con el paso del tiempo y con sus ganancias también compró productos naturistas para venderlos con sus vecinas, familiares y amigos. Doña Clemencia dice que con la ayuda de Vision Fund va a comprar más productos naturistas para la venta. Clemencia le da las gracias a Kiva y Vison Fund por ayudar a la  gente mixteca.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son
Maideli Sofia- se dedica a la venta de ropa.
Martina- se  dedica a la venta de refrescos.
Evarista Flora- se dedica a la venta de refrescos.
Josefa Rufa- se dedica a la venta de ropa.
Ricardo Sixto- se dedica a la venta de carpintería.
Luis Javier- se dedica a la venta de pescado.

Todos ellos también agraceden a la institución por ayudar a la gente indígena.
texts.en:
This group is called the ‘Rough Shore’ it is made up of seven hardworking people originally from the city of Pinotepa Nacional, Oaxaca where the majority of the indigenous people speak the Mixteco language.

One of the members of this group is Mrs. Clemencia, she is 58 years old and is characterized for being a hardworking and humble woman. She sells Mexican treats during the night as well as refreshments, fresh and roasted fish. She has had her business for some twenty years and what she enjoys most is making her tortillas by hand. Mrs. Clemencia says that she began her business selling atoles (a corn starch drink), tamales and fresh juice in her home and later decided to sell Mexican treats with refreshments. She says that as time passed and her earnings increased she bought natural medicines to sell to her neighbors, family and friends. Mrs. Clemencia says that with the help from Vision Fund she will be able to buy more natural medicines to sell. She is grateful to Kiva and Vision Fund for helping the Mixteca people.

The other members of the group are: Maideli Sofia- sells clothing. Martina- sells refreshments. Evarista Flora- sells refreshments. Josefa Rufa- sells clothing. Ricardo Sixto- is a carpenter. Luis Javier- sells fish.

All the members of the group are grateful to the institution for helping indigenous people.

loans.use: buy natural products to sell.

loans.name: Maria Enriqueta Fidencia

texts.es:
La señora Maria aparte de ser esposa y madre de dos hijos es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora, sus hijos se encuentran estudiando y ella para apoyar económicamente los gastos diarios de la familia se dedica a la venta de artículos de bisutería que ella misma elabora entre sus ventas se encuentran aretes, pulseras y collares. 
Maria tiene un año y tres meses de dedicarse a este giro, aparte como un extra se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas de harina en su domicilio. Su motivación son sus hijos y el ayudar a su esposo con la economía de la familia. Solicita crédito para comprar material y poder tener un amplio inventario de materiales para la elaboración de los accesorios y poder brindar variedad de diseños a sus clientes. El anhelo mas grande para Maria es darles una carrera universitaria a sus hijos y es esto lo que la impulsa a trabajar día con día en su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria besides being a wife and mother to two children is an enterprising and hardworking woman. Her children are currently in school and to support them with their daily expenses, Mrs. Maria sells costume jewelry that she makes herself; they include earrings, bracelets and necklaces.

Maria has worked in this field for a year and three months and to get some extra income she also makes and sells flour tortillas in her home. Her motivations are her children and helping her husband meet the household expenses. Maria needs the loan to buy material to increase her supplies to make accessories and give her customers more variety and designs. Maria’s biggest wish is to give her children a university education, this is what drives her each day to keep her business going.

loans.use: buy materials to make earrings, bracelets and necklaces.

loans.name: Rodella

texts.en: Rodella, 38-year old, is a local manicurist and pedicurist in the town of Panduma, Tukuran. She has 4 children and a husband who does fishing for a living. She has been doing this for 7 years and she makes 7,000 monthly. Due to frequent use, she needs to purchase new sets of nail polish. Thanks to GDMPC microfinance for the new loan of 10,000, she is able to acquire all those materials. Being positive for the future, she longs to be well-known so she can expand in some neighboring areas.

loans.use: to purchase new sets of nail polish.

loans.name: Katia Victoria

texts.es:
La señora Katia Victoria de treinta y cuatro años de edad, es originaria de Pinotepa Nacional, Oaxaca donde una de las actividades económicas es la cría de ganado bovino, caprino, caballar y en menor porcentaje la cría de aves de corral.

Doña Katia, como mejor la conocen, se dedica a la matanza de res desde hace siete años y está muy feliz ya que este negocio lo inició su esposo Carlos. Dice que obtuvo este negocio gracias a su esposo Carlos, quien desde hace diez años ya se dedicaba a la matanza, pero por desgracia falleció y ella se quedó a cargo de la carnicería que se encuentra ubicada en el mercado de su comunidad.

Doña Katia menciona que una de las características que debe tener una persona para realizar su trabajo es ser carismática con las personas, tener una buena amabilidad para que las personas vuelvan a comprarle y sobre todo ser una mujer fuerte que le guste el trabajo pesado. Dice que con la ayuda de Kiva y Vision Fund (FRAC) va a comprar más res para la matanza. Le da las gracias a las instituciones por ayudar a las mujeres trabajadoras con deseos y fuerzas de superación.
texts.en:
Katia Victoria, 34, is from Pinotepa Nacional, Oaxaca where one of the economic activities is raising cattle, goats, horses and to a lesser degree barnyard fowl.

Doña Katia, as she’s better known, has worked butchering beef for seven years.  She’s very happy because her husband, Carlos, had started the business.  She says that she got this business thanks to her husband, Carlos, who had been a butcher for ten years but unfortunately he died and she was left in charge of the butcher shop that’s located in her community’s market.

Doña Katia mentions that one of the characteristics a person must have to do her work is to be charismatic with people, to be kind so that people will return to buy and above all to be a strong woman who likes heavy work.  

She says that with help from Kiva and Vision Fund (FRAC) she will buy more cattle to butcher.  She thanks the institutions for helping working women with the desire and the strength to improve.

loans.use: to buy cattle to butcher.

loans.name: Martha Verónica

texts.es:
La señora Martha Verónica es una señora, trabajadora y creativa, originaria de Santiago Pinotepa Nacional, Oaxaca donde una de sus artesanías son la elaboración de juguetes y diversos artículos de madera, machetes y hamacas.
Doña Martha, como mejor la conocen, dice que se dedica a la venta de cadenas, aretes, collares y esclavas de plata desde hace  siete años.
Cuenta que antes que tuviera ese negocio se dedicaba a la venta de calzado por catalogo, pero siempre había querido comprar plata para la venta ya que observaba que sus  clientas compraban muchas pulseras  para combinar con su calzado y decidió vender artes, collares y anillos ya que le parecía un buen negocio.
Con el paso del tiempo se dio cuenta que su negocio le deja buenas ganancias y puede administrar su tiempo para no descuidar su negocio ni su familia.
Dice que esta muy agradecida con fundacion por ayudar a las mujeres trabajadoras, ya que con su ayuda va poder comprar mas plata en aretes, anillos, collares y pulseras para la venta.
texts.en:
Mrs. Martha Verónica is a hardworking and creative person originally from Santiago Pinotepa Nacional, Oaxaca where she sells artisanal goods like toys and several items made from wood as well as machetes and hammocks.

Mrs. Martha as she is most well known, says that she has sold chains, earrings, necklaces and silver bangle bracelets bangle for about seven years.

She says that before she had this business she sold shoes by catalogue but she always wanted to buy silver to sell since she says that her customers bought a lot of bracelets to match their shoes and decided to sell art, necklaces and rings that would be good for business.

As time passed, Mrs. Martha noticed that her business gave her a good income and she could manage her time better to care for her business and family.

She says that she is very grateful to the foundation for helping hardworking women since thanks to your help she will be able to sell more silver earrings, rings, necklaces and bracelets to sell.

loans.use: buy more silver to sell.

loans.name: Fe Y Eperanza Group

texts.es:
El grupo Fe y Esperanza está integrado por 5 mujeres muy unidas y responsables y está ubicado en la comunidad  de Palma Cuata en  la cual a pesar de ser una comunidad grande no hay transporte y la única maneras de llegar es pidiendo ray  o pagando viajes especiales. 

Los integrantes del grupo son: Isabel venta de plantas, Fidelina venta de refrescos, Margarita venta de ropa,  Coral venta de ropa  y  Angélica venta de calzado.

Doña Isabel es una de las mujeres que integran este grupo ella tiene la edad de 55 años, solo estudio la primaria y está casada con don Lucio, ellos tuvieron 6 hijos pero actualmente solo dos dependen de ella y estudian la primaria. Doña Isabel platica que siempre le ha gustado trabajar ya que desde muy pequeña sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar para salir a delante así que siempre ha buscado la manera de vender algo para ganarse su propio dinero, Doña Isabel desde hace un poco mas de 6 años inicio a vender plantas las cuales compra y revende con su amigos y conocidos de la comunidad, cuando ella inicio con su negocio salia a ofrecer sus plantas pero ahora la gente llega a su casa sin necesidad de ofrecer porque ya la conocen y saben donde se ubica su hogar, ella ademas vende prensas de metal para la elaboracion de tortillas  y dice que se venden mucho y ya tiene varios pedidos. Ella invertira este credito en la compra de variedad de plantas y prensas. ella quiere que su negocio crezca cada dia mas y sus ganancias aumenten ya que desea dar una mejor educacion a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The group, Fe y Esperanza, is composed of five women who are very united and responsible. It is located in the community of Palma Cuata, where, despite being a large community, there is no transportation and the only ways to get there are by asking for a ride or by paying for special trips.

The members of the group are Isabel, plant sales; Fidelina, soft drink sales; Margarita, clothing sales; Coral, clothing sales and Angelica, shoe sales. 

Doña Isabel is one of the women who belongs to this group. She is 55 years old, only studied until primary school and is married to Don Lucio. They have six children but currently only two depend on her and are in primary school. Doña Isabel says that she has always liked to work because as a very young child her parents taught her to work to get ahead. Consequently she has always looked for a way to sell something so that she could earn her own money. A little over six years ago she started selling plants, which she buys and resells to friends and acquaintances in the community. When she started her business she used to leave her house to offer her plants but now people come to her home because now they know her and where her house is located. In addition, she also sells metal presses for tortilla-making and says that many are sold and that currently she has several on order.

Isabel will invest the loan in the purchase of a variety of plants y presses. She wants her business to grow more and more each day and her income to increase because she wants to give her children a better education.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of plants for resale.

location.town: Palma Cuata, Acatlan de Perez Figueroa, Oaxaca

loans.name: Jeana

texts.en:
This is Jeana, who is 45 years old and a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Andres and a mother to her three children. She and her husband manage their household while operating their business, a variety store. At this time, Jeana is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy 1 sachet of shampoo, 5 Philippine pesos (PHP) worth of cooking oil, or 1 egg. Jeana earns a profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. She also sells cooked viand (food) for additional income. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1000 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, Jeana is requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Jeana hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery, toiletries, beverages, and other products for her business.

loans.name: Ngor

texts.en: Living in a wooden house located in Dambae district, Ngor and her husband have been growing cassava and rubber trees for ten years to support the family. The business earns them on average 16 US dollar per day. Ngor has five children and four of them are in school and living with the family. Ngor obtained the first loan from VisionFund in 2011 and until now she had received two loans both of which are now completely repaid. The past two loans helped Ngor to better support her family. Ngor is now applying for another loan hoping to get the money to buy seedlings for her farmland and fertilizers and equipment such as bowls for her rubber plantation . She really hopes this loan can help to increase her crop yield so as to generate more income to afford her children's school fees until they finish school.

loans.use: To buy seedlings, fertilizers, and equipment for her rubber plantation

loans.name: Las Dalias Group

texts.es:
Fabiola es un integrante del grupo Las Dalias el cual se integra por 5 mujeres, ellas han decidido llamar a su grupo así ya que se identifican con esta flor. El grupo está ubicado en una región productora de caña y en esta comunidad se encuentra el Ingenio La Margarita uno de los principales productores de azúcar. Doña Fabiola  tiene 33 años, solo estudio la primaria y es madre soltera de un niño llamado Jorge de 10 años de edad quien asiste a la escuela primaria. Fabiola ha trabajado duro toda su vida, pero en el momento en que se convirtió en madre, supo que tenía que hacer un mayor esfuerzo con el fin de dar a su hijo una vida mejor.

Fabiola ha sido siempre comerciante. Empezó vendiendo ropa y, recientemente, decidió vender cosméticos por catálogo. Ella visita a sus familiares y amigos para ofrecer sus productos, y se ha dado cuenta que la venta de productos de belleza es una actividad rentable para los cuales la demanda es siempre creciente. Con este préstamo, Fabiola va a comprar más cosméticos y perfumes para usarlos como muestra y, finalmente, para revender a sus clientes. Ella espera que este crédito le ayude a mejorar su negocio de modo que ella puede ofrecer a su hijo con mejores oportunidades.

Las demás integrantes del grupo son:

Marcela, quien se dedica a la venta de comida.
Imelda, quien vende antojitos mexicanos.
Nieves, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan.
María del Carmen, vende refresco.
texts.en:
Fabiola is a member of the Las Dalias group, which is made up of five women.  They chose this name to identify with the flower.  The group is located in a sugar cane producing region and this community is located in Ingenio La Margarita, one of the main sugar producers.  Fabiola is 33 years old and only has an elementary school education and is a single mother of a 10 year old boy named Jorge, who attends elementary school.  Fabiola has worked hard all her life, but at the moment that she became a mother she knew that she had to make a great effort to provide a better life for her son. 

Fabiola has always been a merchant.  She began by selling clothing and recently she decided to sell cosmetics via catalog.  She visits her family and friends to offer her products and she has learned that selling beauty products is profitable and that the demand is ever increasing.  With this loan she will buy more cosmetics and perfumes to use as samples and finally to resell to her customers.  She hopes that this loan will help her improve her business in a manner that will allow her to provide better opportunities to her son.
 
The other members of the group are:

Marcela, who sells food
Imelda, who sells Mexican snacks
Nieves, who bakes and sells bread
María del Carmen, sells soft drinks

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en: Mary Jane of Alindahaw, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur has been raising ducks for more than 5 years and earns 8,570 PHP per month. She is 37 years old now, yet continues to hang on to her livelihood to give adequate life for her 4 children. She is a new member of GDMPC. In order to enhance her livestock upon selling, she is borrowing 10,000 PHP from GDMPC microcredit to purchase feeding supplies. Mary Jane hopes that someday, her children will be successful in their careers.

loans.use: to purchase feeding supplies

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
This is Analiza, 36, resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Herman, her business partner, and father to her three children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Analiza operates a bakery. Breads and spreads are staples in the usual Filipino cuisine, and are used mostly for breakfast and snacks. The most popular type of bread is the Pandesal, a Filipino version of the Spanish Pan de Sal or salted bread. It is baked during the wee hours of the morning and sold steaming hot to early commuters, students, and workers. Her store is adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy raw supplies like flour, sugar, and butter, which she needs to continue production and expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Analiza hopes her business would grow and dreams to be able to give her children a good future and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Estefita

texts.es:
La señora Estefita es socia del Banco Comunal ”Las Lomas De Yarina" del Distrito de Yarinacocha, Ucayali, tiene 69 años de edad, está casada y su esposo está jubilado (ex trabajador) y tiene 7 hijos mayores de edad y con familia.
Lleva 6 años trabajando con los préstamos que Manuela Ramos le ha concedido para la compra de sus productos, ella se dedica a la venta de Camu-Camu (fruta regional)
Con este nuevo prestamo de S/ 3,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 15 jabas de Camu-Camu, bolsas, cajas para embalaje y una máquina selladora de bolsas.
El negocio que tiene es familiar y todo su préstamo  lo invirtió en este negocio que hoy en día es muy rentable más aun cuando lo exportan, gracias a Manuela Ramos va ir creciendo cada día mas. 
Desea seguir trabajando con Manuela Ramos por más tiempo porque siente que es parte de su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Estefita is a member of the Communal Bank "Las Lomas de Yarina" (The Hills of Yarina), which is located in the District of Yarinacocha, Ucayali. She is 69 years old and married. Her husband is retired from his job and they have seven grown children who have their own families.

Estefita has worked six years with the loans from Manuela Ramos, which were awarded to her so that she could buy her products. She sells "camu camu" (a regional fruit). With this new loan of 3,000 PEN, she will buy 15 crates of "camu camu", bags, packing boxes, and a machine for sealing the bags. This business belongs to her family and the entire loan will be invested. Today her business is even more profitable whenever she exports her products. Thanks to Manuela Ramos, she can continue to grow more each day.

Estefita wants to continue working with Manuela Ramos for a long time because she feels like a part of the family.

loans.use: to buy "camu camu" (a regional fruit), bags, packing boxes, and a machine for sealing the bags.

loans.name: Bebiana

texts.en:
Bebiana is 49 years old and lives in Sto. Niño, Tukuran. She is married and a mother of four children. Bebiana owns and operates a pedicab transportation business. She has been involved in this type of service for two years and earns a monthly income of 3,000 PHP. 

Bebiana has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. She intends to use the money from the loan to purchase pedicab spare parts and accessories. Bebiana has been a good member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, she wants to purchase more pedicabs to use in her business.

loans.use: to purchase pedicab spare parts and accessories.

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
This is Lucita, 60, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Nestor, her business partner. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. At this time, Lucita is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.                             

Lucita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns an income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling them by the piece. Lucita's store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP. She will utilize the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Lucita hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Don Francisco sigue creciendo en su negocio con productos de cosmeticos,ropa, zapatos, el cual vende al contado y al credito, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa en las ventas, partes de sus ventas son encargos, y hoy en dia atraves de los prestamo ha logrado el objetivo, en apoyar a su familia. sus hijos hoy en dia casados.
Con este nuevo prestamo podra invertir en mas productos en cosmeticos variados, chinelas, sandalias, y en utiles escolares, obteniendo mejores ventas a si como sastifacer a sus clientes con los pedidos en tiempo y forma.
texts.en:
Don Francisco continues to grow his business of selling cosmetics, clothing, and shoes. His products are sold for cash or offered on credit. Francisco has the help of his wife in making sales. Part of his sales come from orders. By receiving the loan today, he will be able to accomplish his goal of supporting his family. His children are now married.

With this new loan, Francisco can invest in more products such as various cosmetics, slippers, sandals, and school supplies. He will achieve better sales and be able to fulfill his customers' requests correctly and on time.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, slippers, sandals, and school supplies.

loans.name: Los Encinos Group

texts.es:
Luisa tiene 43 años de edad y comenta que es parte del grupo Los Encinos, dice que le pusieron ese nombre al grupo porque donde viven hay muchos árboles de encino y es por eso que le pusieron ese nombre al grupo. Platica que es originaria de la localidad llamada la Barranca, un lugar lleno de vegetación y donde la principal actividad económica de las personas de esa localidad es la cría y venta de borregos, guajolotes, vacas y al cultivo de aguacate. Platica algo de su vida personal dice que ella no tubo los medios para estudiar ya que sus padres no tenían el dinero suficiente para mandarla a una escuela ya que quedaba muy lejos y no le alcanzaba para los pasajes. Ella se dedica desde hace mas de 10 años a la cría de borregos, guajolotes y gallinas, también tiene en su casa una pequeña huerta de aguacates los cuales los cultiva y vende en temporada de cosecha. Dice que en esta ocasión está pidiendo un crédito a la financiera para la compra de guajolotes pequeños y alimento para estos, comenta que los guajolotes los cría todo el año y cuando ya están grandes los vende en su localidad o en la central de abastos de una población cercana a la de ella, dice que más que nada los vende en el mes de diciembre en las fiestas de fin de año es cuando más ventas tiene de este tipo de animales y también en el mes de julio cuando son las clausuras de las escuelas. 

Las otras nueve personas se llaman Eulalia, MarIa del Carmen, MarIa, Alicia Dolores, María Angélica, Lorena, Antolina, Ricarda y Adela. Ellas invertirán sus créditos en alimento y vacunas para engorda de borregos que venden, compra de borregos, alimento para puercos, compra de puercos.
texts.en:
Luisa is 43 years old and says that she is part of the Los Encinos group; they have this name because where they live there are many encino trees. She is originally from Barranca a place that is full of vegetation and the main work activity is breeding and selling lambs, turkeys, cows and harvesting avocadoes. Luisa says that she did not have the means to get an education since her parents did not have enough money to send her to a school since it was too far away and did not have enough for transportation. She has worked for over 10 years breeding lambs, turkeys and chickens, she also has a small avocado orchard that she tends to and sells the fruit during the harvest season. Luisa says that she needs a loan to buy small turkeys and feed; she says that she breeds them all year long and when they are big sells them in her home or at a nearby central market. Luisa sells more turkeys during December for the end of year celebrations and in July when school is out.

The other nine people in the communal bank are named Eulalia, María del Carmen, María, Alicia Dolores, María Angélica, Lorena, Antolina, Ricarda and Adela. They will use their loans to buy feed and vaccines to fatten up the lambs, buy lambs, feed for pigs, and buy pigs.

loans.use: buy small turkeys and feed.

loans.name: Thorng's Group

texts.en:
Thorng lives in a rural village in the Dambae district of Cambodia. She is forty-nine years old and married with nine children: three daughters and six sons. She now still has eight children to take care of. Two of them are in school while the others work in the family's business. To support their big family, Thorng and her husband have been farming two hectares of cassava farmland and one hectare of rice fields for the past several years. Thorng also raises pigs on-site to gain extra income. Her main challenge is the drop of cassava's price.

Thorng has been with Kiva's partner, VisionFund, for four loan cycles and successfully paid the past loans. These loans have helped her afford to buy more piglets and also keep her children in school. The other member of Thorng's group just joined VisionFund this loan cycle. Thorng is now leading her group of two to apply for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy more piglets, fertilizer and seedlings for her farmland and is also going to use a portion of it to spend on land preparation. She hopes that this loan will earn her more income in order to keep her children in school until graduation.

loans.use: to buy more piglets, fertilizer and seedlings for her farmland.

loans.name: Walter

texts.es:
Walter tiene 29 años, es un hombre soltero y aún no tiene hijos. Su vida la dedica a sus padres y a su hermana Andrea.
Hace 2 años comenzó con la confección de fibras de vidrio en una fábrica de su localidad. Su tiempo en el trabajo transcurre desde las primeras horas del día, hasta muy altas horas de la noche. En todo este tiempo aprendió mucho sobre esta labor, sabe que es rentable por ello quiere más adelante poder tener su propia empresa, para lo que está ahorrando. Pero como desde niño se dedicó a la agricultura, los fines trabaja en sus siembras de habas, alverja y papa en unos terrenos alquilados, los cuales cuida con mucha satisfacción, pues sabe que dentro de algunos meses la cosecha saldrá y podrá tener la ganancia de su esfuerzo y sacrificio, sobre todo para cuidar de su familia.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, se siente tranquilo por el apoyo que recibe, además de agradecer la confianza que depositan en él. Promete cumplir con sus cuotas de manera puntual, pues no defraudará a su grupo, pues sus compañeros son personas solidarias y responsables.
Walter invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para esparcir entre sus cultivos de habas y alverjas.
texts.en:
Walter is a 29-year-old single man with no children. His life is devoted to his parents and his sister Andrea.

Two years ago, Walter started a job producing fiber glass at a factory in his town. His time at this job begins in the early morning hours and lasts until the late hours of the evening. Throughout this entire time, he has learned a great deal from his job. He knows that working is valuable because he wants to have his own business later on and is saving toward that goal. Ever since he was a young boy, Walter has engaged in agriculture. On the weekends, he would plant beans, peas, and potatoes on rented farmland. Caring for his crops gives him great satisfaction because he knows that in a few months he will generate profits as a result of his effort and sacrifice. Everything he does is with the intention of taking care of his family.

This is his second loan with MFP. Walter feels at peace with the support he has received. In addition, he appreciates the trust that has been shown to him. Walter promises to complete his payments on time so that he does not disappoint his group. His fellow group members are supportive and responsible people. Walter will invest the money he requested in the purchase of natural fertilizers that he can apply to his bean and pea crops.

loans.use: to buy natural fertilizers.

loans.name: Los Aguacates De Donaciano Group

texts.es:
Minerva tiene 30 años de edad y es parte del grupo de Los Aguacates de Donaciano, dice que le pusieron ese nombre porque la principal fuente de empleo de todas es el cultivo de aguacate. Ella es originaria de una localidad llamada Donaciano Ojeda donde todavía visten y hablan el idioma mazahua. Doña Minerva se dedica a la elaboración y venta de artesanías en ocoshal desde hace 10 años y también al cultivo de aguacate ya que tiene un huerto con más de 150 árboles de este fruto. Ella está casada con el señor Jorge y tienen 4 niños la mayor llamada Alicia de 13 años estudiante de secundaria, Jorge de 10 años el estudia la primaria, Yareli de 4 años y una niña de 1 año. Platica que cuando es temporada de cosecha de aguacates van los compradores hasta su comunidad a comprar por toneladas y cuando no tienen casi ventas en su localidad sale a la central de abastos de una población llamada Zitacuaro, donde vende los aguacates por cubetas ya que así le ganan un poco más. Dice que está pidiendo un crédito a la financiera para la compra de insumos para el buen cultivo de sus árboles como abonos orgánicos, insecticidas y fertilizantes para que den fruto de mejor calidad. Dice que gracias al crédito mejorara las condiciones de su huerto ya que es su principal empleo de dónde saca mejores ganancias para la educación de sus hijos. 

Las otras 4 integrantes del grupo son Josefina, Delfina, Simona y Olivia y están pidiendo sus créditos para invertirlo en abono, fertilizantes para cultivo de aguacate y material para elaborar artesanías de ocoshal.
texts.en:
Minerva is 30 years old and is a part of the Avocadoes of Donaciano she says they named the communal bank that way because the biggest source of work in the area is growing avocadoes. She is originally from an area called Donaciano Ojeda where they still dress and speak the Mazahua language. Mrs. Minerva has mades and sold artisanal goods in ocoshal (woven pine fibers collected from the forest) for some 10 years. She also has an avocado orchard which has some 150 trees. Mrs. Minerva is married to Mr. Jorge and they have 4 children, the oldest is Alicia, she is 13 and in high school, Jorge is 10 and in primary school, Yareli is 4 years old and the youngest is 1 year old. She says that when it is harvest season the buyers go to her neighborhood to buy by the ton and when she doesn’t have many sales she goes to the local central market called Zitacuaro where she sells the avocadoes by the basket and earns a bit more. Mrs. Minerva needs the loan to buy merchandize to make sure she has a good harvest and to buy organic manure, insecticides and fertilizers to have more quality fruit. She says that thanks to the loan she will improve her orchard’s condition since it is her main source of income and gets the best earnings for her children’s education.

The other 4 members of this communal bank are Josefina, Delfina, Simona and Olivia. They need the loan to buy manure, fertilizers for the avocado crops and materials to make the ocoshal artisanal pieces.

loans.use: buy organic manure, insecticides and fertilizers.

loans.name: La Piramide Group

texts.es:
Luis tiene 23 años de edad, el es parte del grupo la Pirámide y dice que le pusieron así al grupo porque muy cerca de su comunidad se encuentra la zona arqueológica de Zirahuato y hay pirámides de piedra. El es originario de la localidad llamada San Felipe de los Alzati donde la principal fuente de empleo es el cultivo de flor de noche buena ya que es el principal productor a nivel nacional de este tipo de flor que es vendida en los meses navideños. Luis se dedica desde hace mas de 5 años a la venta de artículos para dama como bisutería, perfumería, bolsas de tela, diademas, peinetas, pasadores, pulseras, collares, anillos, pinturas para uñas, maquillajes etc. Platica que todo eso lo vende en diferentes tianguis toda la semana cada día en un lugar diferente, y dice que todo lo que vende va a la capital del país a surtirse de artículos para vender y dice que va allá por que le dan precios más bajos y así el le puede ganar algo. El ahorita está  pidiendo un crédito por que quiere surtir cinturones y carteras para caballero ya que próximamente en el país se festeja el día del padre y así le compren a él los regalos para los papas. Platica que si le dan el crédito él estará muy contento ya que tendrá mejor surtido su puesto. 

Los otros tres integrantes del grupo se llaman Elia, Patricia y Fidel. ellos invertirán sus créditos en la compra de flores de ornato para su venta, en artículos de tienda de abarrotes para surtir local, insumos para cultico de flores de noche buena y de ornato.
texts.en:
Luis is 23 years old; he is a part of the Pyramid communal bank and says it is named like that because the neighborhood is located near the Zirahuato archeological area where there are store pyramids. He is originally from San Felipe de los Alzati and the main source of work is growing poinsettia’s and is the main producer at a national level when it is sold during the Christmas season. Luis for over 5 years has sold women’s accessories like costume jewelry, perfumes, cloth handbags, hair bands, combs, barrettes, bracelets, necklaces, rings, nail polish, makeup, etc. He says that he sells his items in different open markets all week everyday and everything that he sells is bought in the capital since they have lower prices and he can earn more. At present, he needs a loan to buy belts and wallets for men since father’s day is approaching and people are looking for gifts. Luis says that if you give him a loan he will be very happy since he will have a better merchandize in stock.

The other three members of the group are Elia, Patricia and Fidel; they will use their loans to buy decorative flowers, merchandize for a small grocery store, materials for the poinsettia’s and other flowers.

loans.use: buy belts and wallets for men since father’s day is approaching.

loans.name: Biznaga (Flat) Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama  Biznaga y  se integra de cuatro personas dos señoras y dos señores quien  cada uno se encarga de vender  frutas y verduras y viven en un lugar llamado Miguel Hidalgo.

   Quien se le tomo  la entrevista se llama Blanca Flor quien es viuda, y en total tuvo siete hijos quienes ya todos están casados  y es abuela de veinte nietos que la hacen feliz.

    Ella solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra y venta de café molido en la que también acompaña a sus nietos y su  hija a vender frutas y verduras en la que comenta que le va bien ya que con ello  ha estado trabajando  cuatro años y le va bien  ya que con ello ha estado saliendo  adelante.

     En esta actividad inicio ya que se quedo  sola  y decidido  dedicarse a  una actividad que le deje ingresos y así seguirá delante.

    Lo que desea es que con esta pequeña actividad y el préstamo siga trabajando  hasta que dios le preste vida.

   Las persona que integran en el grupo son: Saúl, quien invertirá en la compra de frutas y verduras; Araceli, en la compra de pimenta para luego venderla por kilo y don José María, en la compra de telas para elaborar ropa.
texts.en:
The communal bank is called Biznaga and is made up of four people, two women and two men who sell fruits and vegetables individually in an area called Miguel Hidalgo.

Blanca Flor is a widow and has seven children who are all married, she is a grandmother to twenty grandchildren who make her very happy.

She needs a loan to buy and sell ground coffee since she also accompanies her grandchildren and daughter to sell fruits and vegetables. She has had her business for four years and is doing well; it has allowed her to get ahead.

Blanca Flor began her work when she was alone and decided to get a job that would give her an income to help her have a better life.

She wishes to see her business grow and the loan will help her keep working until God gives her life.

The people who are part of the communal bank are Saúl, he will buy fruits and vegetables, Araceli will buy pepper to sell later on by the kilogram and Don José María who will buy fabrics to make clothing.

loans.use: buy and sell ground coffee.

loans.name: Ciudad Real (Flat) Group

texts.es:
El grupo  se llama "Ciudad Real" y se integra de  tres personas  quienes viven en una comunidad llamada Llano Grande en donde celebran la fiesta del santísimo San Felipe.

Rosa vive en unión libre con el señor José con quien procreo cinco hijos de los cuales cuatro aún están a su responsabilidad. Ella solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de ingredientes como son: harina, aceite, huevo, queso, royal , entre otros, para la elaboración de panes en donde lleva trabajando un año y comenta que le va bien ya que con ello. Rosa inició con esta actividad para apoyarse para cubrir los gastos de su hogar y para proveer a su pequeña familia con lo más necesario. Su meta es seguir trabajando para así con el tiempo tener una panadería más grande en donde pueda trabajar más días a la semana.

Los otros dos integrantes del grupo son: Miguel quien invertirá en la compra y venta de marranos para venderlos destazado por kilo y la señora María Graciela quien invertirá en la compra de marrano para venderlo por kilo.
texts.en:
This group is called "Ciudad Real" and is made of three people. They live in a community called Llano Grande where they celebrate the feast day of the most holy Saint Philip.

Rosa is in a civil union with José with whom she has had five children, four of which are still under her care. She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of ingredients such as flour, oil, eggs, cheese, Royal [a brand of baking powder], among others, to make bread. She has been making bread for one year and she says that she has done well with it so far. Rosa began this business in order to help cover the household expenses and to provide her small family with necessities. Her goal is to continue working so that with time she can have a larger bakery where she can work more days per week.

The other members of the group include Miguel who will invest in the purchase and sale of pigs, which he butchers and sells by the kilogram, and María Graciela who will invest in the purchase of pigs to sell by the kilogram.

loans.use: to pay for the purchase of ingredients to make bread.

loans.name: Savon's Group

texts.en:
A married mother of six children, Savon is now aged 56 years old and she lives with her family in a village located in the Dambae district of Cambodia. Out of her six children, she still has three children dependent on her and they are still in school. She is a peasant who has been planting cassava on one hectare of farmland and cashews on three hectares of farmland for several years to make a living. The main challenge for her family’s business is the drop of cassava prices. 

Savon’s group consists of two members who live in the same village. She is a second-cycle client with VisionFund while the other member is just with VisionFund this cycle. The first loan has enabled Savon to support her child to become a primary teacher. With her current business, she can earn around 16,000 KHR per day to spend for daily expenses. Now she is requesting a loan with VisionFund. Savon, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizer and use a portion of it to spend for land preparation. She hopes to increase her income so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian lives in Buluk. She sells charcoal, and has been in business for two years. She is 32 years-old, married, and has five children; four of them are still in school. 

Lilian heard about Kiva partner BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Alia

texts.en:
Alia is 46 years old and a married woman, a mother of 4 children. She lives in Al Hashmi-Amman, Jordan.

Alia is looking to have a loan of 1000 JDs so she can increase her income by selling more clothes from her home. In the future she can open her own store.

loans.use: to sell clothes

loans.name: Hosnyah

texts.en:
Hosnyah is a conservative woman so she is unwilling to upload her photo on the internet. The photo is of her son.

Hosnyah is 50 years old and a widow, a mother of three children. She lives in Marka, Amman, Jordan.

Hosnyah is looking to have a loan of 800 JDs so she can buy new furniture for her home.

loans.use: to buy new furniture for her home

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen lives in Buluk. She sells at a food stall, and has been in business for five years. She is 46 years-old, married, and has three children; all of them are still in school. 

Hellen heard about Kiva partner BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase beans and maize flour. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase beans and maize flour to sell.

loans.name: Ghosoon

texts.en:
Ghosoon is 34 years old and a married woman, a mother of five children. She lives in Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan.

Ghosoon is looking to have a loan of 600 JDs so she can expand her project in clothing sales. Her income will increase so she can open her own store in the future.

loans.use: to buy and sell clothes

loans.name: Asala

texts.en:
Asala lives in Buluk. She sells charcoal, and has been in business for five years. She is 46 years-old, married, and has three children; all of them are still in school. 

Asala heard about Kiva partner BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 2500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Sabriah

texts.en:
Sabriah is 50 years old, married and a mother of three children. She lives in Al Salt, Al Balqa, Jordan.

Sabriah is looking to have a loan of 300 JD so she can improve the living conditions in her house and renew her furniture so her family will live in a healthy environment.

loans.use: to renew her furniture

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy phone charging cards and accessories

loans.name: Najwa

texts.en:
Najwa is 50 years old and divorced. She lives in Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan.

Najwa is looking to have a loan of 400 JD so she can increase her income from selling clothing. She will buy more quantites of clothes and sell them to neighbors and other people.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for trading

loans.name: Maha

texts.en:
Maha is 34 years old and married woman. She is a mother of four children and lives in Madaba, Jordan.

Maha is looking to have a loan of 500 JD so she can increase her business by purchasing more quantities of cosmetics, clothes and perfumes for trading so her income will increase. In the future, she's looking to cover more areas.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, clothes and perfumes to sell

loans.name: Makram

texts.en:
Makram is 64 years old and married with one child. She lives in Hay Nazal, Jordan.

Makram is looking to have a loan of 1,500 JD so she can buy raw materials for her crafts and handmade products.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her crafts

loans.name: Sameera

texts.en:
Sameera is 33 years old and a married woman, a mother of two children. She lives in Sahab, Jordan.

Sameera is looking to have a loan of 400 JDs so she can expand her work sewing clothes and sell to more people so her income will increase.

loans.use: to expand her project sewing clothes

loans.name: Nicolas Alberto

texts.es:
Nicolas es un joven emprendedor que desde muy corta edad aprendió gracias a su padre todas las actividades del campo, es por esto que desde hace un tiempo, cuando se casó y tuvo su hijo, decidió montar su propio negocio de cultivo de frutas y verduras y del cual ahora genera los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar. Nicolas ahora tiene 23 años de edad y gracias a su experiencia trabajando ha logrado construir una familia la cual es su mayor motivación para trabajar fuertemente en su negocio todos los días. Debido a que quiere diversificar sus ingresos, Nicolas busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de una vaca lechera de modo que pueda tener una fuente de ingresos adicional y de esta manera su familia pueda tener una mejor calidad de vida.
De esta manera podrá seguir creciendo junto a su familia y cada vez irán progresando para salir adelante superando las adversidades que le ha presentado la vida.
texts.en:
Nicolas is a young entrepreneur who learnt, thanks to his farther, about many different types of farm work from a very young age. This is why, when he got married and had a child a while back, he decided to start his own business growing fruit and vegetables from which he now makes the income he needs to support his family.Nicolas is now 23 years old and, thanks to his work experience, has managed to start a family, which motivates him to work hard in his business every day.

In order to diversify his sources of income, Nicolas is seeking a loan which will allow him to buy a dairy cow. This will provide him with an additional source of income and allow him to improve his quality of life. In this way, he will be able to continue to grow with his family and keep moving forward, overcoming any difficulties that life may bring him.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow in order to obtain an additional source of income so that he can improve his family's quality of life.

loans.name: Noreidis

texts.es:
Noreidis se encuentra casada y tiene 3 hijos de 9, 8 y 4 años de edad, a quienes siempre les ha querido ofrecer una buena calidad de vida y mejores oportunidades de estudio. Debido a que el salario que ganaba su esposo no era suficiente para poder sostener todos los gastos que se generaban en su hogar, Noreidis decidió buscar la manera de poder generar ingresos con los cuales pudiera contribuir económicamente para el sostenimiento de los gastos en su hogar; fue así como montó su venta de productos de uso doméstico donde ofrece a sus clientes productos como plásticos, enseres de hogar, cobijas, sillas, ventiladores, entre otros productos más. Gracias al esfuerzo que pone diariamente en su trabajo ha logrado posicionarlo y tener muy buenas ventas, hasta el punto en que actualmente tiene la oportunidad de generar un empleo directo de modo que puede mejorar la calidad de vida de una persona diferente a su familia. Noreidis ha venido teniendo muy buenos pedidos por parte de sus clientes, por lo que ahora busca un préstamo que le permita acceder a la compra de productos de uso doméstico para poder responder a los grandes pedidos que le han hecho sus clientes.

De esta manera su negocio seguirá creciendo y así podrá seguir ofreciendo en su hogar una estabilidad económica que les permitirá obtener una mejor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades para progresar.
texts.en:
Noreidis is married and has three children ages 4, 8, and 9. She has always wanted to offer her children a good quality of life and better opportunities for education. Because her husband's salary was not enough to cover all of their household costs, Noreidis decided to look for a way to generate an income and contribute to the household finances. This is how she started her home products business. She sells products such as plastic goods, household fittings, bedclothes, chairs, fans, and other items. Thanks to her daily hard work, she has been able to firmly establish her business and have very good sales. She has been so successful that she is now able to generate work for an employee and improve the quality of life of someone outside of her family. Noreidis has been getting very good orders from her customers, so she is now looking for a loan which will allow her to purchase home products in order to fill the large orders that her customers have made.
This way, her business will continue to grow, and she will be able to contribute to her household's economic stability, allowing them to obtain a better quality of life and better opportunities to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy home products in order to respond to the many orders her customers have made.

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 34-year-old divorced man and a father of one child. He lives in Al Salt, Al Balqa, Jordan.

Ahmad is looking to have a loan of 1500 JD so he can buy raw materials to do upholstery and to design blinds upon his clients' request.

loans.use: to buy materials to do upholstery and design blinds

loans.name: Sameera

texts.en:
Sameera is a conservative woman who is unwilling to upload her photo on the internet. The photo is of her son.

Sameera is 54 years old, married and a mother of two children. She lives in Al-Hashmi, Amman, Jordan.

Sameera is looking to have a loan of 400 JD so she can expand her trading in cosmetics and perfumes to buy her own home in the future.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics & perfumes to sell

loans.name: Elda

texts.es:
Elda se encuentra casada y tiene 8 hijos a quienes siempre les ha querido ofrecer una buena calidad de vida, y a pesar de que 3 de sus hijos ya son mayores y tienen la oportunidad de acceder a un empleo, aún 5 de sus hijos se encuentran a su cargo y Elda y su esposo siempre buscan ofrecerles una buena educación. Para ello, Elda trabaja desde hace aproximadamente 20 años en la venta de frutas y verduras de manera ambulante en la plaza de mercado de su municipio, y de esta manera contribuye económicamente junto con el salario de su esposo a los ingresos del hogar y así sostener todos los gastos que allí se generan. Gracias a su trabajo, Elda ha tenido la oportunidad de ofrecer en su familia una buena calidad de vida y poco a poco brindar oportunidades de progreso para todos, por lo que ella valora mucho su negocio y siempre busca sacarlo adelante. Gracias a que en la temporada actual las cosechas de los productos son a muy bajo precio, Elda busca que un préstamo le permita comprar frutas y verduras para surtir su negocio aprovechando los precios bajos de la temporada y así poder tener una buena rentabilidad en su negocio.
De esta manera su negocio podrá seguir ofreciendo a sus clientes buenos productos a buenos precios y seguirá teniendo en su hogar la posibilidad de ofrecer a sus hijos todo lo necesario. Elda sueña con algún día poder tener su propio local y no seguir trabajando de manera ambulante, y así podrá hacer que sus clientes la localicen más fácil y sus ventas aumenten considerablemente.
texts.en:
Elda is married and has eight children for whom she has always wanted to ensure a good quality of life. Although three of her children are adults and have the opportunity to get a job, five of her children still remain in her care. Elda and her husband always strive to ensure they have a good education. To do this, Elda has worked selling fruit and vegetables in the street market of her town for approximately 20 years, which allows her to contribute financially to her family income along with her husband’s salary, and to cover all her household expenses. Thanks to her job, Elda has been able to offer her family a good quality of life, and gradually help them all get ahead in life. This is why she truly appreciates her business, and always tries to ensure that it prospers. 

As the current seasonal harvest of produce is at a very low price, Elda has requested a loan to allow her to buy fruit and vegetables to supply her business, taking advantage of these low prices and obtaining a better return for her business. In this way Elda’s business will be able to continue offering good products at good prices to her customers, and she will be able to give her children all they need at home. 

One day Elda would like to have her own premises and not have to work in the street market. This would allow her customers to find her more easily, and her sales would increase considerably as a result.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables to supply her business, taking advantage of the seasonal low prices and obtaining a better return for her business.

loans.name: Shahd

texts.en:
Shahd is a conservative person so she is unwilling to upload her picture on the internet. The woman in the photo is her mother.

Shahd is  a 20-year-old married woman from Irbid, Jordan and a mother of one child.

Shahd is looking to improve her family's living conditions so she is requesting a loan of 300 JD to do maintenance on her house.

Because Shahd is under 30 years old, her loan is considered as a youth loan.

loans.use: to do maintenance on her house

loans.name: Kefah

texts.en:
Kefah is a conservative woman so she is unwilling to upload her photo on the internet. The photo is of her husband.

Kefah is 34 years old and a married woman, a mother of 8 children. She lives in Madaba, Jordan.

Kefah is looking to have a loan of 400 JDs so she can increase her home sales to help her to own a grocery shop in the future.

loans.use: to expand hier home grocery

loans.name: Samiah

texts.en:
Samiah is a conservative person and she is unwilling to upload her picture on the internet, thus the man in the photo is her husband.

Samiah is a 52-year-old married woman from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan and a mother of 3 children.

Samiah is a tailor. She works from her house and is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase a new sewing machine. Samiah is looking to purchase a house for her family instead of their current rented one.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Raeda

texts.en:
Raeda is a conservative person so she is unwilling to upload her picture on the internet. The woman in the photo is her mother.

Raeda is  a 39-year-old married woman from Irbid, Jordan and a mother of 3 children.

Raeda is working from her house. She sells blankets and is requesting a loan of 400 JD to purchase more quantities for business purposes.

loans.use: to purchase blankets for business purposes

loans.name: Kholoud

texts.en:
Kholoud is a conservative person so she is unwilling to upload her picture on the internet. The man in the photo is her husband.

Kholoud is a 34-year-old married woman from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan.

Kholoud is looking to improve her family's living conditions so she is requesting a loan of 600 JD to do maintenance on her house.

loans.use: to do maintenance on her house

loans.name: Wafaa

texts.en: Wafaa is a 30-year-old married woman from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan. She is the mother of five children. Wafaa is looking to improve her family's living conditions, so she is requesting a loan of 600 Jordanian dinars to do maintenance on her house.

loans.use: to do maintenance on her house

loans.name: Alia

texts.en:
Alia is 54 years old, married, and a mother of one child. She lives in Madaba, Jordan.
Alia is requesting a loan of 800 JOD in order to expand her business by buying more raw material for milk sales.

loans.use: to buy raw material for milk sales.

loans.name: Odai

texts.en:
Odai is a 21-year-old single man who lives in Bani Kenanah, Irbid, Jordan.
Odai is requesting a loan of 500 JOD in order to improve and develop his restaurant business.
As Odai is under 30 years old his loan is a youth loan.

loans.use: to develop his restaurant business.

loans.name: Yusra

texts.en:
Yusra is a 45-year-old married woman from Madaba, Jordan, and the mother of seven children. She makes dairy products and is requesting a loan of 1500 JOD to purchase materials for making dairy products.
Yusra is a conservative person who does not wish to upload her picture on the internet thus the man shown in the photo is her son.

loans.use: to purchase materials for making dairy products.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is a 36-year-old divorced woman from Madaba, Jordan, and a mother of two children.
Hanan has a humble grocery store at her house and she also sells clothes. She is requesting a loan of 600 JOD to purchase goods for trading purposes. She is looking to save a good amount of money for her girls' education.

loans.use: to purchase goods needed for her business.

loans.name: Fooza

texts.en:
Fooza is a 63-year-old widow who lives in Mababa, Jordan.
She is requesting a loan of 400 JOD in order to improve her housing and living conditions and to make them more healthy.

loans.use: to improve her housing and living conditions.

loans.name: Shareefa

texts.en:
Shareefa is a 59-year-old married woman from Al Salt, Al Balqa, Jordan, and a mother of five children.
Shareefa is looking to improve her family's living conditions, and is therefore requesting a loan of 600 JOD to do maintenance work on her house. She is looking to expand her house and construct new rooms.

loans.use: to do maintenance work on her house.

loans.name: Sa'ed

texts.en:
Sa'ed is 31 years old and a single man. He lives in Al-Hashmi-Amman, Jordan.

Sa'ed is looking to have a loan of 1000 JDs so he can continue his wedding preparations, buy the missing items and make the necessary arrangements.

loans.use: to prepare for his wedding

loans.name: Mekhled

texts.en:
Mekhled is 29 years old and a married man. He is a father of 2 children. He lives in Sahab, Jordan.

Mekhled is looking to have a loan of 500 JDs thus he can paint his home and buy new furniture.

Mekhled is under 30 years old so his loan is considered as a youth loan.

loans.use: to paint his home and buy furniture

loans.name: Sabah

texts.en: Sabah is a 54-year-old widow who lives in Hay Nazal, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to expand her chocolate-making project by buying more raw materials. She would like to open her own store in the future.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make chocolate.

loans.name: Manal

texts.en:
Manal is 42 years old and single. She lives in Nao'or, Jordan.

Manal is looking to have a loan of 400 JD so she can buy more home stuff and sell it to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell

loans.name: Zaid

texts.en:
Zaid is 23 years old and a single man. He lives in Madaba, Jordan.

Zaid is looking to have a loan of 300 JDs so he can improve his household living conditions and fix up his house.

Zaid is under 30 years old thus his loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to improve his household living conditions

loans.name: Irma Deisy

texts.es:
Doña  Irma  es  una  persona  muy emprendedora   dedicada  a su negocio,  vive con 4 hijos. En  Choluteca  en  el  sur de  Honduras. Y  tiene  más  de 6   años  de  tener este tipo  de negocio.
El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de  maíz, leña, cal, refrescos, azúcar, café, pan, dulces, confites, manteca, harina  y  arroz  de  esta manera  incrementara mas sus ventas. Con el préstamo espera incrementar sus  ventas  y  a si  atender  mejor a sus clientes.
Doña Irma espera  tener  mejores  ventas  y  así tener  mejores  ingresos  para  tener  mejor  calidad de  vida.
Doña Irma sus sueños es poder darles a sus  hijos una educación.  

Choluteca  Honduras - Abril del 2012
texts.en:
Irma is a very enterprising person dedicated to her business.  She lives with her four children in Choluteca, in the south of Honduras.  She has had this type of business for more than six years.

She will invest the loan in buying corn, firewood, lime, beverages, sugar, coffee, bread, sweets, candies, lard, flour, and rice.  In this way she will increase her sales.  With the loan she hopes to increase her sales and in this way better serve her customers.

Irma hopes to have better sales and thus better income to have a better quality of life.  Irma's dream is to be able to give her children an education.

Choluteca, Honduras, April 2012

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, lime, beverages, sugar, coffee, bread, sweets, candies, lard, flour, and rice.

loans.name: Hanadi

texts.en:
Hanadi is 25 years old and a single woman. She lives in Sahab, Jordan.

Hanadi is looking to have a loan of 400 JDs so she can expand her work selling phone recharge cards so her income will increase.

Hanadi is under 30 years old so her loan is considered as a  youth loan.

loans.use: to buy phone recharge cards

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
This is the second time Mariam is obtaining a loan from Tamweelcom. She benefited from her first loan to establish her business and purchase equipment needed.

Now, Mariam is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase materials needed for her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed for her business.

loans.name: Hanyah

texts.en:
Hanyah is a 55-year-old married woman who lives in Hay Nazal, Jordan. Her son is married and lives independently. She is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to expand her work in cosmetics, clothes and blanket sales. Her dream is to have her own farm in the future.
Hanyah is a conservative woman who does not wish to upload her photo to the internet, so the photo shows her son.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, clothes and blankets for resale.

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is a married man. He has 6 children with ages ranging from 10 years to 18 years. He describes himself to be respectful and obedient. He operates a bicycle  and he provides transportation. He has been involved in this business for 7 years and employs one staff member. His business is located near a busy market  and his primary customers are local residents of the nearby estates. He describes his biggest business challenge to be stiff competition within the area. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy additional bicycles. His business goal is to own a taxi for providing transportation to the airport within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will increase his income from the business.

loans.use: to buy additional bicycles.

loans.name: Rosalba

texts.es:
Rosalba trabaja desde hace más de 20 años en cafeterías y restaurantes, y gracias a la experiencia adquirida hoy tiene un negocio en el cual se caracteriza por ofrecer a sus clientes un muy buen servicio y una muy buena calidad en sus productos. Hace aproximadamente 2 años tomó en arriendo una cafetería en la cual su principal producto son los buñuelos, y de esta manera genera ingresos con los cuales contribuye económicamente para el sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar, donde convive con su esposo y su hijo. Rosalba ha tenido muchas dificultades en su vida, pero siempre la ha acompañado sus ganas de salir adelante para continuar progresando junto a su familia. Debido a la temporada invernal, el costo del queso es muy elevado y así su margen de ganancia disminuye considerablemente, y es por esto que ahora busca un préstamo para comprar queso y así aprovisionar sus insumos para cuando la temporada de invierno llegue no tenga que pagar altos costos por el queso.
De esta manera su negocio podrá seguir teniendo un buen margen de ganancias y así podrá seguir generando los ingresos que requiere en su hogar, de modo que su familia podrá tener una buena calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades económicas para progresar.
texts.en:
Rosalba has worked for more than 20 years in coffee shops and restaurants. Thanks to the experience gained, today she has a business which known for offering its customers very good service and great quality products. 

Approximately two years ago she rented a coffee shop in which her main product is buñuelos [cheese fritters]. This way she makes an income with which she contributes economically to support her home expenses, where she lives with her husband and her son. Rosalba has had many difficulties in her life, but she has always had her will to get ahead and continue to progress in life along with her family.

Due to the winter season, the cost of cheese is very high and therefore her earning margin decreases considerably. Because of this she is now looking for a loan to buy cheese and thus build up her provisions so that when the winter season comes she won't have to pay high costs for the cheese. This way her business will be able to continue to make a good profit margin. Therefore she will continue to generate the income that she requires in her home so that her family can have a good quality of life and better economic opportunities to move forward.

loans.use: to buy cheese and thus build up her provisions so when the winter season comes she won't have to pay high costs for the cheese

loans.name: Naun Bonifacio

texts.es:
El Señor Naun, tiene 36 años de edad, vive con su  familia, tiene 3 hijo, Su actividad principal es la venta de mercadería, desde hace más de 4 años,  Naun esta solicitando el préstamo para la compra de productos como ser: pescado, tilapía, camarón, carnes, embutidos, mantequilla y otros productos de consumo para la atención de sus clientes, el realiza sus ventas de manera ambulante, en algunas comunidades, Naun es una persona muy trabajadora, ya que su negocio ha sido su principal fuente de ingresos, Naun se ha ganado la clientela por su buena atención, con el préstamo solicitado a Naun le contribuirá a tener un mejor negocio, y así obtener mejores ingresos para cubrir los gastos en el hogar, y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
Naun uno de sus sueños es  tener los servicios públicos donde el vive, para comprar un frezeer y mejorar sus ingresos.
Danli El Paraíso, Honduras - Abril 2012
texts.en:
Naun is 36 years old, he lives with his family, and has three sons.  For more than four years, his main business has been the selling of merchandise.  

Naun is requesting a loan for the purchase of products such as fish, tilapia, shrimp, meat, sausages, butter and other consumer products.  In order to serve the needs of his customers, he makes street sales in some communities.  Naun is a hard worker.  Since his business has been his main source of income, he has earned customers through his excellent service.  

The loan requested by Naun will help him have a better business and obtain a better income to cover household expenses, and give his family a better quality of life.  One of his dreams is to have public services provided where he lives, to purchase a freezer, and improve the income.

Danli El Paraíso, Honduras - April 2012

loans.use: to purchase fish, tilapia, shrimp, meat, sausages, butter and other products for his business.

loans.name: Blanca Fabiola

texts.es:
Blanca es una madre soltera cabeza de familia de sus 2 y que ha tenido que superar grandes adversidades en su vida, para lo cual sus ganas de salir adelante le han permitido seguir progresando y brindándoles una buena calidad de vida sus hijos. Hace un largo tiempo Blanca inició con su esposo una venta de dulces y snack, negocio que poco a poco fue creciendo y que luego se comenzó a vender a los clientes gran variedad de productos de la canasta familiar. Posteriormente su esposo murió y Blanca quedó a cargo del negocio, negocio que hasta hoy le ha venido generando los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar. Blanca busca que un préstamo le permita comprar productos de la canasta familiar con los cuales pueda surtir su negocio y así ofrecer una mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes.
De esta manera su negocio seguirá saliendo adelante y poco a poco irá cumpliendo su sueño de sacar sus 2 hijos adelante y brindarles buenas oportunidades económicas para progresar.
texts.en:
Blanca is a single mother, the head of her household, and has two children. She has had to overcome great difficulties throughout her life, and her desire to get ahead has allowed her to move forward and provide her children with a better quality of life. A long time ago Blanca and her husband began to sell candies and snacks. This business gradually grew and, over time, they started to sell a large variety of staple goods to their customers. When her husband passed away Blanca was left in charge of the business. To this day, the business has given her the income she needs to meet her household expenses. 

She plans to use her loan to buy staple goods to supply her business, offering a wider variety of products for her customers. In doing so her business will continue to prosper, and she can realize her dream of helping her children to get ahead and give them financial opportunities to prosper.

loans.use: to buy staple goods to supply her business, offering a wider variety of products for her customers.

loans.name: Deisy Elizabeth

texts.es:
Doña Deisy, esta casada, tiene 43 años de edad, tiene 4 hijos y vive con su esposo en su propia casa de habitación en el departamento de Valle en el sur de Honduras. El negocio de Doña Deisy es la venta de ropa y la sastrería.
Doña Deisy trabaja la sastrería en su casa de habitación en una aldea en la zona sur de Honduras. Doña Deisy esta solicitando la cantidad de 8,000.00 lempiras para la compra de Telas y Sandias para la venta.  De esta manera generar mayores ventas en su negocio, por lo que sus ingresos serán mejores.
Entre los sueños a futuro de doña Deisy esta la idea de hacerle mejoras a su vivienda ya que por razones económicas no ha podido terminar su casa.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Abril 2012
texts.en:
Deisy, 43, is married and has four children.  She lives with her husband in her own home located in the department of Valle in the south of Honduras.  Deisy has a business selling and tailoring clothes.  Deisy works on tailoring clothes in her home in a village in the south of Honduras.  

Deisy is requesting 8,000 Honduran lempiras (HNL) to buy fabric and watermelons to sell. This way, she will generate higher sales in her business resulting in better income. Among Deisy’s dreams for the future is making home improvements as she has not been able to finish building her house due to economic reasons. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - April 2012

loans.use: to buy fabric and watermelons to sell in her business.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora R. is 41 years old and she has lived in the village of Cabisera 14-16 (Ilagan) since she was born. Her husband and two children happily live there. Her husband, Orlando, is a corn and rice farmer in their village. Her children are Jessa, 14, who is currently in high school, and Jhondel, 17, now in the fourth year of high school. 

Leonora hopes to support the education of her two children through the assistance of her husband and support coming from her snack-vending business. She cooks banana cue and soups for her neighbors. The snacks are sold easily in an hour even when she does not go house to house. She would like to expand this into selling soft drinks and cooking the famous “pansit” (soft noodles in the local language).
