They are on their second collaboration with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, with the goal of meeting customer demand. This group of women sells traditional “pagnes” and other types of fabric as well as used clothing, which is what Rokia does, for example.

Rokia, the one wearing a blue T-shirt, plans to sue her loan to buy two bundles of used clothing. She buys from wholesalers at the big market of Bamako. She sells at the big market of Bougouni and out of her home, to a customer base composed of both men and women, retail, for cash and on credit. She plans to achieve an average monthly income of 22,000 West African Francs, one part of which will be used to help her husband provide for everyday family needs, and the other invested in her business.

loans.use: to buy used clothing.

loans.name: Amena

texts.en: Amena lives in Kator. She sells food from a food stall, and has been in business for five years. Amena is 36 year old, married, and has five children; four of them are still in school. Amena heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer, and this is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase onions and tomatoes to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase onions and tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Adilina

texts.en: Adilina lives in Kator. She operates food stall and has been in business for five years. She is 26 year old, married, and has three children; two of them are still in school. Adilina heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase onions and flour to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay for school fees.

loans.use: to purchase onions and flour to sell.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is 26 years old and single. He lives in Al Russeifeh, Jordan.

Khaled is looking to have a loan of 2,000 JOD to cover his wedding expenses and preparation costs. He will take another loan in the future to fix his home and improver its condition

Khaled is under 30 years old so his loan is a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for his wedding expenses

loans.name: Zubaidah

texts.en:
Zubaidah is 62 years old and a married woman. She is a mother of one child. She lives in Hai Nazal, Jordan.

Zubaidah is looking to have a loan of 1500 JOD so she can expand her work in fish sales; she will buy more quantites and cover a big area.

In the future Zubaidah looks to open a fish store and increase her income so she can build a new floor above her home to have more space.

loans.use: to buy fish for business purposes

loans.name: Hana'a

texts.en:
Hana'a is 35 years old and a married woman. She lives in Hay Nazal, Jordan. She is a mother of three children.

Hana'a is looking to have a loan of 450 JOD so she can buy more quantities of blankets for business purposes. She wishes to open her own store in the future which would increase her income and help her to buy a home.

loans.use: to purchase blankets for her business

loans.name: Dulcisima

texts.en:
Dulcisima is 53 years old, married, and has five children. Her spouse works as a laborer. Dulcisima's business is preparing and selling peanut butter. She has been in this kind of business for five years. She usually earns about PHP 3,000 each month. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy sugars and peanuts to use in the food-selling business. 

Dulcisima would like to keep growing as a successful entrepreneur for the overall welfare of her family.

loans.use: to buy sugar and peanuts to use in the food selling business.

loans.name: Badegna Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe BADEGNA sont toutes mariées, ont une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles monogames à  MASSABLACOURA, un des quartiers de la ville de Bougouni (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à neuvième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce général, la vente de condiments avec  DJENEBA , du  bois de chauffe et du riz .
DJENEBA ,  en première de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo, compte acheter avec son  prêt, 50 Kilos de piments et et 1 carton de cube maggi . Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Bougouni auprès des grossistes. Elle vend au  grand marché de Bougouni et à domicile à une clientèle composée de femmes en général, en détail, au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 90.000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée  pour l’appui de son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the BADEGNA group are all married women who average 38 years of age and 4 children each.  They live in monogamous families in Massablaccoura, a neighborhood of the city of Bougouni (3rd administrative region of Mali).

It is the ninth time that these women are working with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, in order to meet the needs of their customers.  DJENEBA sells condiments, while other women of the group are involved in general retail business, or sell firewood and rice.

Sitting first from the right in the photo, DJENEBA is planning to buy 50 kilos of pimento and one box of "Maggi" bouillon cubes. She buys her goods from wholesalers at the grand market in Bougouni.  She sells on that same market or from home to a customer base which mostly consists of women.  She sells retail, for cash and on credit.

DJENEBA is expecting average monthly profits to reach 90,000 CFA francs, part of which will be used to help her husband cover the daily expenses, while the rest will be invested in her business.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
El joven Julio Cesar es soltero, tiene 24 años de edad, logro graduarse, como perito contador, pero actualmente trabaja como confesionista, inicio este negocio por necesidad y hasta el momento lleva 3 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de sus padres.

Solicita un crédito que lo utilizara para la compra de telas e hilos y mejorar su produccion de camisas, espera en el futuro espera tener un negocio amplio.
texts.en:
Young Julio Cesar is a single 24-year-old. He  graduated as an accountant but currently works as a clothing manufacturer. He started in the business out of necessity and he now has has 3 years experience. He has the full support of his parents.

He requests this loan to buy fabrics and threads and improve his shirt production. He hopes that in the future he will have an ample busines.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread for clothes manufacturing

loans.name: Chocaman Group

texts.es:
La señora Santiaga es casada, tiene 53 años de edad, se dedica al comercio a la venta de ropas de todo tipo y tamaño, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, el negocio que tiene inició siendo vendedor ambulante, lleva hasta el momentos 21 años de experiencia. 

Decide organizar un grupo para pedir y solicitar un préstamo, que lo utilizaran para la compra de mercadería para la venta, ya que se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva, van a comprar bufandas, medias, calcetines, chumpas, gorras, y entre otros tipos de ropa. Los demás integrantes del grupo se dedican al comercio, y los demás a la crianza d animales domésticos. En el futuro desean tener su negocio con locales comerciales.
texts.en:
Santiaga is 53, married and makes a living selling clothes of all kinds and sizes. She didn't have the chance to get an education. She started her business as a street vendor and so far she has 21 years experience.

She decided to start a group to request a loan that they will use to buy merchandise to sell. Since she sells new clothes they are going to buy scarves, stockings, socks, jackets, and hats among other types of clothing.

The other members of the group make a living in commerce and the rearing of domestic farm animals. In the future they want to have their own business with business premises.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Benkan Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe BENKAN sont toutes mariées, ont une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles monogames à  MASSABLACOURA, un des quartiers de la ville de Bougouni (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à deuxième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Ce groupe de femmes fait l’achat et la vente de condiments alimentaires et du savons liquide  avec   DJELIKA , de pagnes, des friperies, du bois et des céréales.
DJELIKA  ,  en première position sur la photo en boubou noir, compte acheter avec son  prêt, 2 colis de condiments alimentaires, 4 cartons de savons liquide. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Bougouni auprès des grossistes. Elle vend au  grand marché de Bougouni et à domicile à une clientèle composée de femmes en général, en détail, au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 60.000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée  pour l’appui de son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the BENKAN group are all married women who average 30 years of age and 4 children each.  They live in monogamous families in Massablacoura, a neighborhood of the city of Bougouni (3rd administrative region of Mali).

It is the second time that these women are working with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, in order to meet the needs of their customers. While DJELIKA buys and sells condiments and liquid soap, other women of the group sell pagnes (colorful West-African fabrics), used clothing, wood and grains. 

Sitting in the front row and wearing a black boubou, DJELIKA is planning to use her loan to buy 2 packages of condiments for cooking and 4 boxes of liquid soap.  She buys her goods from wholesalers at the grand market in Bougouni. She sells on that same market and from home to a customer base which mostly consists of women. She sells retail, for cash and on credit.

DJELIKA is expecting average monthly profits to reach 60,000 CFA francs, part of which will be used to help her husband cover the daily expenses, while the rest will be invested in her business.

loans.use: to buy various goods (condiments, liquid soap...)

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: Desde Guayaquil José Luis de 37 años nos cuenta su historia, símbolo de superación y fuerza de voluntad. Su tienda la inicio hace varios años producto de un accidente que sufrió el cual lo dejo imposibilitado por un tiempo, debido a este suceso la empresa en la que trabajaba deicidio liquidarlo así que deicidio invertir el dinero. Su esposa Blanca quien a sido su apoyo incondicional es ama de casa y le ayuda en el negocio. El éxito de su tienda es que abre todos los días de lunes a domingo sin horario establecido. Tienen 2 hijos quienes estudian en una escuela fiscal cerca de su domicilio. El préstamo lo va a invertir en su negocio comprando una vitrina, víveres, confetis, arroz, azúcar. Le gustaría en próximos años ver su negocio ampliado.
texts.en:
From Guayaquil José Luis, 37, tells us his story, a symbol of triumph and willpower.  He opened his store several years ago as a result of an accident he had that left him disabled for a time.  Because of this event, the company he worked for decided to liquidate him so he decided to invest his money.  

His wife, Blanca, who has been his unconditional support is a housewife and helps him in his business.  His store’s success is because it’s open every day from Monday to Sunday with no fixed schedule.  

They have two children attending a public school near their home.  He will use the loan to invest in his business buying a display case, foodstuffs, confetti, rice and sugar.  He’d like to see his business expand over the next years.

loans.use: to buy a display case, foodstuffs, confetti, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Arnold

texts.en:
Arnold believes that "Patience and hard work are the key to overcome poverty." He is 32 years old and still single. His ambition in life is to help his parents support his younger brothers and sisters, and to improve their status of living. He plans to educate his younger bothers and sisters so that they will earn degrees and become professionals someday. 

Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, Arnold needs to improve his hog-raising business to generate additional income. He is asking for a loan of P30,000 to buy feed, vitamins, and vaccines needed in hog-raising. The loan will help him to work toward his plan of growing his business to help his family.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, vitamins, and vaccines

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George's primary source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice to sell. This way, he earns about PHP 10,000 each harvest season twice a year.

George is now 41 years old, married, and has four children attending to school. He would like to improve his farming output but he has inadequate funds to sustain his crops. He is now asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides to use in farming. This will help improve good growth of his crops and will increase his income too. 

George would like to keep producing abundant harvests from the farming business in order to pay his children's education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides to use in farming.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.en: Leonor is a mother who is married to a farmer and they raise their family in a village. They are gifted with five children and they want them to each earn a degree so that they find good jobs someday. To generate income, they help each other in managing their farm lot by planting corn and vegetables to sell. They aim to increase their yields so they have the income to meet their daily needs and pay for their children's education. Leonor and her husband have plans to expand their planted corn to ensure high production, but they have not been able to do so because they cannot afford it. So, Leonor is requesting an additional P35,000 to buy corn seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides needed in corn farming. This loan will enable she and her husband to expand their planting. They are hoping to have a fruitful harvest.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides needed in corn farming

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.en:
Rice farming is the business of Bernardo. He lives in his small house at Roma Sur with his wife and four children. His wife helps him manage the farming business. They have been planting and harvesting rice for over 10 years and earn a minimum income of PHP 8,000 per harvest season. 

Now, Bernardo is applying for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy rice seeds and fertilizers for crop maintenance. He hopes to keep growing rice to meet all his children's needs for school fees.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and fertilizers for crop maintenance.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia raises crops in her village at Roma Sur. She is widowed, therefore she carries the burden alone of sending her three children to school. She pays for laborers who help her in sowing, tilling, planting, and harvesting rice. She has been in the farming business for 10 years and earns PHP 12,000 each harvest season twice a year. The money is used for meals, electric bills, and school fees. 

Leticia would like to make her crops produce more so she is now asking for a loan to maintain her farm. She is asking for PHP 15,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides and to pay for the labor costs of farming. She hopes to keep making the business profitable and gain enough funds for her family's progress.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides and to pay for labor costs of farming

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.en:
Eugenio is a determined father. He is giving the best of his efforts to the rice farming business. He plants and harvests rice to sell. Eugenio's wife is his partner in the business. Income from his business is used for meals and the allowances of his four children. He would like to give them the best education. He is now asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers, insecticides and pesticides. This will help maintain good growth of his crops. 

Someday, Eugenio hopes for an abundant harvest and to keep boosting up his profits.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers, insecticides, and pesticides.
